item.title: elephant jokes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
40 Elephant Jokes That Will Make You Roar

40 Elephant Jokes That Will Make You Roar

Elephant jokes are a fun way to enjoy moments with friends and family. These jokes bring smiles and laughter, making any gathering more joyful. Whether you are at a party or just sharing a laugh over dinner, elephant jokes can lighten the mood.

Elephants are known for their intelligence and gentle nature. They live in families and communicate with one another in interesting ways. Because of their unique characteristics, elephant jokes can be funny and relatable. They help us appreciate these amazing animals while also providing a good laugh.

In this article, we have selected some of the best elephant jokes from various sources, Tuesday (8/10/2024). These hilarious jokes are perfect for people of all ages, and will surely make anyone laugh out loud.

The Best Elephant Jokes That Will Make You Roar

1. What do you get when you cross a fish with an elephant? Swimming trunks!

2. Why do elephants need trunks? Because they don't have handbags.

3. How do you know if an elephant loves to travel? She always packs her trunk!

4. Why did the elephants get kicked out of the pool? Their trunks kept falling down.

5. How do you prevent an elephant from charging? Take away his credit card.

6. Why couldn't the two elephants go swimming together? Because they only had one pair of trunks!

7. What time is it when you find an elephant in your car? Time to get a new car.

8. Did you know that elephants can grow up to 11 feet? But most just have

9. What did the elephant want for his birthday? A trunk full of presents.

10. Why do elephants never get hot and bothered? They always have their ear conditioning on.

11. What do you get if you cross a kangaroo and an elephant? Giant holes all over the Australian continent.

12. What happens if you cross an elephant with a potato? You get a ton of mashed potatoes.

13. What does Tarzan say when he sees a herd of elephants in the distance? "Look, a herd of elephants in the distance."

14. Why did the elephant lawyer not take the 2-day case? He wasn't a fan of brief cases, he preferred trunks.

15. Why do elephants have trunks? Because they would look funny with a suitcase.

16. Why do elephants never forget? Because nobody ever tells them anything!

17. Why did the elephants decide to stage a stampede? They felt that their issues weren't being herd.

18. What is the difference between en elephant and a plum? An elephant is grey.

19. Where does the elephant vigilante live? In the gray area.

20. What did the elephant scientist do when he found a breakthrough in his study of animal sounds? He trumpeted the announcement.

Funny Elephant Jokes for Kids

1. What do you do when you see an elephant with a basketball? Get out of its way!

2. Why didn't the African elephant like playing UNO? There are too many cheetahs.

3. Why did the elephant get pulled over? He sped through the stomp sign.

4. What happens when an elephant gets lightheaded? It ele-faints.

5. Why couldn't the elephant ride the bus to school? Its trunk wouldn't fit under the seat.

6. What did the elephant say to her son when he was naughty? "Tusk, tusk!"

7. What did the peanut say to the elephant? Nothing. Peanuts can't talk.

8. How can you tell the difference between and elephant and a marshmallow? The elephant won't float when you put it into a cup of hot chocolate.

9. Why did the elephant cross the road? Because the chicken retired!

10. How do you stop an elephant from smelling? Tie a knot in his trunk!

11. Why are elephants scared of computers? Because of the mouse!

12. What do you call an elephant that can't stop cleaning? Cinderelephant!

13. What do you call an elephant in a phone box? Stuck!

14. Why did the elephant quit the circus? He was being paid peanuts!

15. Why are elephants wrinkled? Have you tried ironing one?

16. How do you get a baby elephant out of the lake? Wet.

17. What do elephants do when they accidentally stub a toe? They dial the number of the tow truck.

18. How do you place an elephant in the fridge? You open the door of the refrigerator, place the elephant inside and close the refrigerator door.

19. What happens when you cross an elephant and a rhino? Elephino.

20. What's the best way to raise a baby elephant? With a forklift.

item.title: Things To Do In Istanbul
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
5 Romantic Things To Do In Istanbul For Honeymoon Couples

5 Romantic Things To Do In Istanbul For Honeymoon Couples

Are you planning a romantic honeymoon in Istanbul? There are so many things to do in Istanbul that will make your honeymoon unforgettable. From exploring the city's rich history and breathtaking architecture to indulging in delicious Turkish cuisine, there are endless opportunities for romance in this vibrant city.

Istanbul offers a unique blend of traditional and modern attractions that are perfect for newlyweds looking to create lasting memories. Whether you're strolling hand in hand through the ancient streets of Sultanahmet or enjoying a sunset cruise along the Bosphorus, there are endless opportunities for romance around every corner.

In this article, we will share some romantic things to do in Istanbul for newlyweds, according to various sources, Tuesday (6/2/2024).

With its rich culture, stunning scenery, and endless opportunities for romance, this vibrant city is the perfect place to celebrate your love.

1. Try Turkish Bath For Couples In Istanbul

If you're visiting Istanbul for a romantic getaway, trying a Turkish bath (also known as a hamam) as a couple can be a really special experience. This traditional spa treatment is not only relaxing but also offers a chance to connect with your partner in a unique and intimate setting.

In a Turkish bath, you can enjoy a soothing steam bath followed by a scrub and massage. The warm and peaceful atmosphere of the hamam can help you both unwind and de-stress, while also providing a chance to bond and create lasting memories together.

Istanbul is known for its beautiful and historic hamams, and many of them offer special services for couples. It's a great way to pamper yourselves and make your honeymoon even more special.

2. Visit The Iconic Hagia Sophia

When planning a honeymoon trip to Istanbul, visiting the iconic Hagia Sophia is a must-do activity for couples. This historic landmark is an architectural marvel with a rich and fascinating past. Originally built as a Christian basilica in the 6th century, it later became a mosque and eventually a museum.

Couples can immerse themselves in the beauty and history of the Hagia Sophia as they explore its stunning domed ceilings, intricate mosaics, and impressive architecture. The grandeur of the building is sure to leave a lasting impression and provide the perfect backdrop for romantic moments and photos.

Additionally, the Hagia Sophia is located in the heart of Istanbul, making it convenient for you to visit other nearby attractions and enjoy the vibrant city atmosphere.

From the beautiful Blue Mosque to the bustling Grand Bazaar, there is plenty to see and experience in the surrounding area.

3. Explore Topkapi Palace

Another romantic thing for newlywed couples to do in Istanbul is to explore the beautiful Topkapi Palace. The palace offers a romantic and picturesque setting for couples to immerse themselves in the rich history and culture of Turkey.


As you explore the palace and its beautiful architecture, you'll feel like you've traveled back to the time of the Ottoman Empire. The palace has lovely courtyards and many treasures to see. It's a place where love and history come together.

While strolling hand in hand through the beautiful gardens or getting lost in the labyrinth of rooms and chambers, you'll have plenty of opportunities to create lasting memories with your loved one. And don't forget to visit the Harem, where you can indulge in the romance of the sultan's private quarters and marvel at the intricate design and beauty of the surroundings.

Visiting Galata Tower in Istanbul is a must-do for honeymoon couples looking for a romantic and breathtaking experience.

4. Enjoy The Panoramic View Of Istanbul From Galata Tower

Galata Tower is a historic tower that was built in the 14th century.

The tower now houses a museum where you can learn more about the history of the tower and the surrounding area.

The best thing to do in Galata tower is to climb to the top of the tower. From the top, you can enjoy a panoramic view of the city, with stunning views of the Bosphorus Strait, Golden Horn, and the old city of Istanbul.

The 360-degree view from the observation deck allows you to take in the beauty of the city from a unique perspective, making it a memorable experience for couples looking to create lasting memories on their honeymoon. You can spend quality time together, taking in the picturesque scenery and capturing the perfect moments with your camera.

5. Explore The Grand Bazaar

When planning a honeymoon in Istanbul, one activity that should not be missed is exploring the Grand Bazaar. This historical market is one of the oldest and largest covered markets in the world. It is a great place for couples to immerse themselves in the vibrant culture of the city.

As you wander through the maze of streets and alleys, you'll find a wide variety of shops selling everything from traditional Turkish rugs and textiles to beautiful jewelry and ceramics. The Grand Bazaar is a treasure trove of unique souvenirs and gifts that honeymoon couples can bring back home to remember their trip.

In addition to shopping, the bazaar is also a fantastic place to experience the local cuisine.

There are countless cafes and restaurants where you can sample delicious Turkish delights and refreshing beverages while taking in the bustling atmosphere.

item.title: Miscarriage Quotes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
45 Miscarriage Quotes: Touching And Powerful Words To Comfort Your Grieving Heart

Are you feeling sad because you lost a baby before it was born? If you are, we have some special miscarriage quotes to share with you.

45 Miscarriage Quotes: Touching And Powerful Words To Comfort Your Grieving Heart

Most people look forward to having a new family member. But when a baby is lost before being born, it can be very painful and sad. Getting back to normal after such a tough time can be hard and challenging.

If you're feeling sad because of a miscarriage, these miscarriage quotes might help you feel better. They can't change what happened, but they can help you wash away your sadness, embrace the bad experience, and get back on your feet to live your life with a smile.

In this article, we've collected some meaningful miscarriage quotes from various sources, Wednesday (27/9/2023).

We hope these beautiful quotes, no matter when you read them, can help you feel less sad after losing your special future family member.

A. Meaningful Miscarriage Quotes

1. "You never arrived in my arms, but you will never leave my heart." - Zoe Clark-Coates

2. "To lose a child is to lose a piece of yourself." - Dr. Burton Grebin

3. "You didn't stay for long, but in those precious few weeks, you changed me forever." - Zoe Clark-Coates

4. "Sometimes the smallest things, take up the most room in our heart." - A.A. Milne

5. "My wife had a miscarriage. We have rarely talked about it. It did make me more aware of the sanctity of human life, how precious every child is." - Jack Kemp

6. "There's nothing that symbolizes loss or grief more than a mother losing a child." - David LaChapelle

7. "If there ever comes a day when we can't be together, keep me in your heart, I'll stay there forever." - Winnie The Pooh

8. "Your heart stopped but my love for you did not."‍ - Zoe Clark-Coates

9. "Those we have held in our arms for a little while, we hold in our hearts forever." - The Prophet

10. "You were carried for only a moment but are loved for a lifetime." - Unknown

11. "The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen, or touched, but are felt in the heart." - Helen Keller

12. "A miscarriage is not a failure, because a failure implies that it's something you can control. Miscarriages are beyond our control."

- Dr. Simone Whitmore

13. "Losing a pregnancy is like losing a part of oneself that will never be made whole again." - Unknown

(Photo by Liv Bruce on Unsplash)

14. "I never heard you, but I hear you. I never held you, but I feel you. I never knew you, but I love you." - Unknown

15. "Your absence has gone through me like thread through a needle. Everything I do is stitched with its color." - S. Merwin

16. "I carried you every second of your life and I will love you for the rest of mine." - Unknown

17. "I wish I could have held you just once before you left us." - Conan Gray

18. "Some say you are too painful to remember. I say you are too precious to forget." - Unknown

19. "There is a unique pain that comes from preparing a place in your heart for a child that never comes." - David Platt

(Photo by Jackson Simmer on Unsplash)

20. "If you've lost a child, I need you to know that you're not alone. Our grief has woven together and we've found ourselves a part of this club that no one ever wanted to join. And it sucks, it's okay to say that.

- Kaitlyn Facista

21. "A mother is never defined by the number of children you can see, but by the love that she holds in her heart." - Franchesca Cox

22. "She/he was born silent into this world, but their little life spoke volumes." - Unknown

23. "We never lose our loved ones. They accompany us; they don't disappear from our lives. We are merely in different rooms." - Paulo Coelho

24. "You'll always be my favorite what if." - Unknown

25. "When a child loses his parent, they are called an orphan. When a spouse loses her or his partner, they are called a widow or widower. When parents lose their child, there isn't a word to describe them."

- Ronald Reagan

1. "When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough." - Maurice Maeterlinck

B. Miscarriage Quotes About Grieve To Comfort Your Heart

2. "Tears are the silent language of grief." - Voltaire

3. "It is perfectly okay to admit you're not okay." - Unknown

4. "A mother's grief is as timeless as her love." - Joanne Cacciatore

5. "All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on." - Havelock Ellis

6. "It hurts because it matters." - John Green

7. "No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear." - C.S. Lewis

8. "When a child dies, you bury the child in your heart." - Korean Proverb

9. "Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom."

- Rumi

10. "How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard." - A. A. Milne

(Photo by Michael Fenton on Unsplash)

11. "The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living." - Marcus Tullius Cicero

12. "Grief is the price we pay for love." - Queen Elizabeth II

13. "To live in hearts we leave behind is not to die." - Thomas Campbell

14. "Grief is not a disorder, a disease or sign of weakness. It is an emotional, physical and spiritual necessity, the price you pay for love. The only cure for grief is to grieve." - Earl A. Grollman

15. "Comfort comes from knowing that people have made the same journey. And solace comes from understanding how others have learned to sing again."

- Helen Steiner Rice

16. "Death ends a life, not a relationship." - Jack Lemmon

17. "Grief is the last act of love we can give to those we loved. Where there is deep grief, there was great love." - Unknown

18. "There is no right way to grieve; there is only your way to grieve, and that is different for everyone." - Nathalie Himmelrich

19. "A life may last just for a moment, but memory can make that moment last forever." - Unknown

20. "Death leaves a heartache no one can heal. Love leaves a memory no one can steal." - Unknown

item.title: Viral
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Woman Loses $800K Disability Case After Photos of Her Winning Tree-Throwing Competition

She took part in a competition after claiming she was involved in an accident that caused severe neck pain.

Woman Loses $800K Disability Case After Photos of Her Winning Tree-Throwing Competition

In Ireland, a woman lost over $800,000 in a court case. That's because of a photo of her throwing a Christmas tree in a contest. In that contest, she won.

Kamila Grabska, 36, took legal action against an insurance company called RSA Insurance in Ireland.

She said a car accident in 2017 caused severe pain in her neck and back.

According to the Irish Independent, that made it difficult for her to work for five years.

trstdly © 2024

Grabska is a mother of two from Ennis in County Clare. She said the accident happened when someone hit her car from behind.

She stated it made it difficult for her to hold her children and do housework.

She stopped working soon after the accident.

This woman got money for being disabled.

According to the Telegraph, she also said she lost more than $500,000 in past and future pay.

But now, she risked losing money.

Photos of her taking part in the competition were spread. The competition is to throw a large Christmas tree as far as possible.

"The judge said the photos showed her throwing a large real Christmas tree in a fast ran. I think she overstated her claim. So, I will dismiss the case,"

said the judge, as reported by the Irish Independent.

trstdly © 2024

Grabska said in court that she did not fake her injuries. She just wants to live a normal life, according to the Telegraph.

Fox News Digital media tried to contact Grabska's lawyers, but they did not immediately respond.

trstdly © 2024

item.title: drama
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
6 Best Romantic-Comedy Japanese Dramas That Make Your Heart Flutter

Romantic comedy genre dramas from Japan always have interesting stories.

6 Best Romantic-Comedy Japanese Dramas That Make Your Heart Flutter

Film lovers have at least one favorite Japanese film or drama.

Many people like romantic comedy genre dramas from Japan, which always have interesting stories.

Here are some recommendations for Japanese dramas in the romantic genre!

L-DK (2014) is romantic-comedy Japanese film. L-DK tells the story of Aoi Nishimori, who lives far from her parents. Aoi lives in an apartment building that also houses a student from her school.

My Tomorrow, Your Yesterday (2016) tells about Takatoshi Minamiyama sees Emi Fukuju and falls in love with her at first sight. They begin to date and enjoy happy days together, but Emi reveals her secret to him.

Fujimiya Kaori is known to be quite cold and reluctant to socialize with anyone. However, this actually attracts Yuki to try and win her love.

One Week Friends (2017) is tells about Hase Yuki, who is interested in his school friend Fujimiya Kaori.

When her friends find her lies, she finds a male student who fits the criteria of her fake boyfriend.

The synopsis of WOLF GIRL AND BLACK PRINCE (2016) tells the story of Erika Shinohara, a high school student who lies that she has a boyfriend.

Let Me Eat Your Pancreas (2017) is tells about Haruki Shiga and the most popular student named Sakura.
Sakura actually likes Haruki. But Sakura has pancreatic disease.

However, she realizes that the letters are from the future. Naho can see what will happen in the future from the letter she sent.

Oranges (2015) is tells about Naho Takamiya, a high school student who receives mysterious letters.

item.title: first person view
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
7 Recommended Horror Movies with 'First Person' or 'Found Footage' View You Must Watch!

First-person point of view restricts what the audience sees to the viewpoint of a single character.

7 Recommended Horror Movies with 'First Person' or 'Found Footage' View You Must Watch!

This Spanish found-footage horror film unfolds as a television reporter and her cameraman follow firefighters into an apartment building where residents have been infected with a mysterious virus.

As chaos erupts and the building is quarantined, the film's first-person perspective immerses viewers in the visceral horror of the outbreak, building tension with each terrifying encounter.

Rec (2007)

Adapted from a Spanish movie, Rec, the movie tells story of a television reporter, Angela Vidal, and her cameraman as they accompany a team of firefighters on a routine emergency call to an apartment building.

However, their routine assignment quickly turns into a nightmare when they find themselves trapped inside the building, which has been quarantined due to a deadly virus outbreak.

Quarantine (2008)

Considered a pioneer of found-footage horror, "The Blair Witch Project" follows three student filmmakers who venture into the Maryland woods to document the legend of the Blair Witch.

Shot with handheld cameras, the film blurs the line between fiction and reality, immersing viewers in the escalating fear and paranoia of the characters as they become lost in the wilderness.

The Blair Witch Project (1999)

Directed by Oren Peli, "Paranormal Activity" revolves around a young couple who set up cameras to document the supernatural occurrences plaguing their home.

The film's minimalist approach and use of surveillance footage create a sense of intimacy and claustrophobia, intensifying the suspense as the demonic entity terrorizes the unsuspecting couple.

Paranormal Activity (2007)

Directed by Matt Reeves and produced by J.J. Abrams, "Cloverfield" follows a group of New Yorkers as they attempt to survive a monstrous creature's rampage through the city.

Presented as recovered footage from a camcorder, the film captures the chaos and devastation of the attack, offering a visceral and relentless thrill ride.

Cloverfield (2008)

In this found-footage horror film, a paranormal investigation team explores an abandoned psychiatric hospital rumored to be haunted. As they delve deeper into the asylum's dark history, the crew encounters malevolent spirits and unexplained phenomena, leading to a descent into madness captured by their cameras.

Grave Encounters (2011)

"V/H/S" is an anthology horror film comprised of found-footage segments, each offering a different tale of terror. From a group of friends encountering a sinister cult to a honeymoon gone awry, the film weaves together chilling stories captured on various recording devices, showcasing the diverse and disturbing potential of the found-footage format.

V/H/S (2012)

item.title: Gigi Hadid
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Gigi Hadid Stuns at Victoria's Secret Fashion Show 2024 After Six-Year Hiatus

She was honored to be back with so many women she admires.

Gigi Hadid Stuns at Victoria's Secret Fashion Show 2024 After Six-Year Hiatus

Gigi Hadid made a stunning return to the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show on October 15, 2024, after a six-year hiatus.

Gigi Hadid kicked off the show in a striking pink outfit.

She featured a belted silk one-piece with shorts and a plunging neckline.

She added large diamond earrings and gladiator-style heels. Gigi also wore pink wings.

A verse of INXS accompanied her performance of “Never Tear Us Apart.”

The show was Hadid's first appearance since 2018.

Gigi expressed her excitement on social media before the show.

She was honored to be back with so many women she admires.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Victoria's Secret (@victoriassecret)

Model Lineup

The 2024 Victoria's Secret fashion show featured iconic models, including Bella Hadid, Irina Shayk, and Adriana Lima.

This year's lineup is notable for its diversity and includes models from various backgrounds.

Overall, Gigi Hadid's return to the Victoria's Secret runway was celebrated as a landmark moment.

item.title: Percy Jackson
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
55 Percy Jackson Quotes That Will Ignite Your Imagination

Whether facing our fears, standing up for what is right, or embracing change, Percy teaches us that true strength comes from within. (Photo by instagram.com/percyseries)

55 Percy Jackson Quotes That Will Ignite Your Imagination

Percy Jackson, the beloved protagonist of Rick Riordan's popular book series, has captured the hearts and imaginations of readers worldwide.


One of the reasons for Percy's enduring popularity is his funny and profound quotes that inspire us to believe in ourselves. This article will explore some of the most memorable Percy Jackson quotes that will ignite your imagination and remind you of the power within you.

1. "Being a hero doesn't mean you're invincible. It just means that you're brave enough to stand up and do what's needed."

2. "Sometimes the best way to solve a problem is to stop thinking about it."

3. "It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality."


4. "Humans see what they want to see."

5. "Don't feel bad for one moment about doing what brings you joy."

6. "You have to know what you are willing to die for, to truly live."

7. "Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes."

Percy Jackson Quotes

8. "The real world is where the monsters are."

9. "I am not a psychopath. I'm a sociopath. Do your research."


10. "If my life is going to mean anything, I have to live it myself."

11. "The bravest people are the ones who don't mind looking like cowards."

12. "There is always a way out for those clever enough to find it."

13. "It takes strength and courage to admit when you are wrong."

14. "People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed."

15. "Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy."

16. "I'm not good at solving riddles, but I am good at smashing things."

17. "Don't judge someone until you've stood at their crossroads and walked in their shoes."


18. "Life is only precious because it ends, kid."

19. "It's not what you do that defines you, but how you choose to do it."

20. "Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.

21. "The world is not fair, and often fools, cowards, liars and the selfish hide in high places."


22. "People are funny about death. In movies and books, it's romanticized. But when it happens in real life, it's just ugly."

23. "It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one."

24. "When you have a choice between doing what is right and doing what is easy, remember that true heroes always choose the harder path."

25. "The hardest choices in life aren't between what's right and what's wrong but between what's right and what's best."

26. "You might as well ask an artist to explain his art or ask a poet to explain his poem. It defeats the purpose. The meaning is only clear through the experience of it."

27. "Change is never easy, but always possible."


28. "It's a lot easier to be brave when you're not alone."

29. "The way we win matters."

30. "Being a hero means ignoring how silly you feel."

31. "Even the bravest people can have moments of weakness."

32. “Deadlines just aren’t real to me until I’m staring one in the face.”

33. "Sometimes, the most unexpected people can be the ones to surprise you."


34. "The world is full of monsters, both literal and metaphorical."

35. "Heroes are not born; they are made through choices and actions."

36. "Courage is not the absence of fear but the ability to act in spite of it."

37. "Sometimes you have to lose the battle to win the war."

38. "The greatest power we have is the power of choice."

Percy Jackson Quotes

39. "It's okay to be scared. Being scared means you're about to do something really, really brave."

40. "The future is only scary if you don't know where you're going."

41. "Don't let small-minded people dim your light. Shine on, and show the world what you're made of."

42. "It's not about the size of the dog in the fight; it's about the size of the fight in the dog."

43. "You can't choose your family, but you can choose how you deal with them."

44. "Sometimes, you have to let go of who you are to become who you are meant to be."

45. "The only way to survive is to believe you always will."

46. "You can't control everything, but you can control how you react to things."

47. "Fear is natural. The key is to face it head-on and not let it control you."


48. "Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass; it's about learning to dance in the rain."

49. "In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take."

50. "The best way to predict the future is to create it."

51. "Don't let your past dictate your future."

52. "Sometimes, the most ordinary things can be made extraordinary simply by doing them with the right people."

53. "You are never defined by your past mistakes, but by the choices you make moving forward."

54. "True power comes from within, not from the external world."

55. "The only limits that exist are the ones you place on yourself."

Percy Jackson is a beloved character who has captured the hearts and imaginations of readers, young and old alike.


His adventures are filled with wit, courage, and wisdom that can inspire us all. Here are 55 Percy Jackson quotes that will ignite your imagination and remind you of the power of bravery, choice, and believing in yourself. Percy Jackson's words are filled with wisdom and insight that can resonate with readers of all ages.

He reminds us that even in the face of adversity, we have the power to choose our path and shape our destiny. Whether facing our fears, standing up for what is right, or embracing change, Percy teaches us that true strength comes from within.

item.title: angel quotes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
30 Angel Quotes That Will Soothe the Soul

30 Angel Quotes That Will Soothe the Soul

Angels are often seen as symbols of hope and guidance. They bring peace to our hearts and minds. In this article, we have collected some beautiful angel quotes that can help calm your mind and soothe your soul.

Angel quotes are perfect for someone who's looking for encouragement or someone who needs a reminder of the goodness around them. These quotes will touch your heart and lift your spirits.

Read on to find a little bit of heaven in each quote. Also, get ready to brighten your day with their wisdom!

Guardian Angel Quotes

  • "All of us have times in our lives when things may not be going so well, yet, we get through those times, and maybe, just maybe, you had 1000 Angels helping you by just that 1%!" – Catherine Pulsifer

  • "Angels are beyond our understanding, but God created them and sent them to tell us important messages, for example, to the shephards telling them about the birth of Jesus." – Catherine Pulsifer

  • "Children often have imaginary playmates. I suspect that half of them are really their guardian angels." – Eileen Elias Freeman
  • "Angel of God, my guardian dear to whom God's love commits me here; Ever this day be at my side, to light and guard, to rule and guide." – Old English Prayer

  • "Every night and every morning thank your own guardian angel for peace and for the regeneration of all the cells in your body, and for joy." – Dorie D'Angelo

  • "I am your Guardian Angel. I am a part of you. I am here to guide you, love you and protect you. You need not hide your feelings from me, for they are my feelings also." – Michelle Gordon

  • "Guardian Angel pure and bright, guard me while I sleep tonight." – Angel Prayer

  • "I think we all do have a guardian angel. I believe they work through us all the time, when we are thoughtful and good and kind to each other." – Roma Downey

  • "The guardian angels of life sometimes fly so high as to be beyond our sight, but they are always looking down upon us." – Jean Paul Richter

  • "We all long for a guardian angel in our lives. The luckiest among us call that angel mother." – Richelle E. Goodrich

Beautiful Angel Quotes

  • "Angels are spirits, flames of fire; they are higher than man, they have wider connections." – Matthew Simpson

  • "Angels are like diamonds. They can't be made, you have to find them. Each one is unique." – Jaclyn Smith

  • "Dear Angels above I know you're here, and sense how I am feeling, please bless me with your strength and love to bring me peace and healing." – Mary Jac

  • "Angels have no philosophy but love." – Terri Guillemets


  • "I believe in angels, the kind that heaven sends. I'm surrounded by angels, and I call them my best friends." – Pamela Daranjo
  • "Angels are heralds of eternity sent to help mankind break through when they cannot break out." – Graham Cooke

  • "It is not because angels are holier than men or devils that makes them angels, but because they do not expect holiness from one another, but from God alone." – William Blake

  • "Angels are inseparable friends, who bring strength and consolation to those who include them in their lives. In truth, Angels are our best friends." – Janice T. Connell

  • "They care for, protect, and guide God's people, frequently intervening or bring messages to people from God."– Mary C. Neal, MD

  • "Angels are not any extraordinary beings with wings and a halo. They are ordinary people living ordinary lives. But they have special qualities that touch our heart and soul in special ways." - Unknown

Angel Quotes to Inspire You

  • "Make yourself familiar with the angels, and behold them frequently in spirit; for without being seen, they are present with you." - St. Francis de Sales

  • "Harmony is like singing angels; life is sweet, peaceful, and fulfilling. Let's get harmony on the inside, and we will positively change our worlds on the outside!" – David DeNotaris

  • "We are each of us angels with only one wing, and we can only fly by embracing one another." - Luciano de Crescenzo

  • "Angels descending, bring from above, echoes of mercy, whispers of love." - Fanny J. Crosby

  • "Little deeds of kindness, little words of love, you always make me happy, you are an angel from above." – Judith Wibberley

  • "Angels are bright still, though the brightest fell." – William Shakespeare

  • "Angels only care about what you look like on the inside. A pure heart is the vessel that contains a soul's true beauty."― Molly Friedenfeld

  • "Sometimes we are like an angel with one wing, and we necessarily need the other wing of a similar angel to keep flying." - M. K. Soni

  • "To find your angels… Start trusting your inner voice and intuition." – Melanie Beckler

  • "Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is rest and let your angels wrap you in their loving wings. They've got you covered." – Anna Taylor

Author

Rizki Amelia Putri (Intern Writer)

item.title: Best Cities To Live In USA
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
28 Addiction Quotes: Powerful Words on Overcoming Addiction

28 Addiction Quotes: Powerful Words on Overcoming Addiction

Addiction is like a shadow that follows you everywhere. It’s whispering the promises of comfort but leaving you lost in darkness. Addiction is taking hold of your mind and body. And it’s not just about drugs or alcohol. It can be ordinary things like video games, social media, or chocolate. However, amidst the struggle, there are addiction quotes that resonate with the pain of addiction.

These addiction quotes serve as a guiding light for those who struggle with addiction. Luckily, this article offers some of the best addiction quotes from writers, actors, and therapists. May these addiction quotes inspire us to recover. yuris-alhumaydy-unsplash

Addiction Quotes for Recovery

  • “Addiction begins with the hope that something “out there” can instantly fill up the emptiness inside.“ – Jean Kilbourne

  • “Recovery is not for people who need it. It’s for people who want it.”

  • “Asking for help is really the beginning of any sort of recovery process.” - Marc Maron

  • “An addict is someone who uses their body to tell society that something is wrong.” - Stella Adler

  • “Remember just because you hit bottom doesn’t mean you have to stay there.” – Robert Downey Jr.

  • “Recovery is something that you have to work on every single day and it’s something that doesn’t get a day off.” - Demi Lovato

  • “Addiction, at its worst, is akin to having Stockholm Syndrome. You’re like a hostage who has developed an irrational affection for your captor. They can abuse you, torture you, even threaten to kill you, and you’ll remain inexplicably and disturbingly loyal.” - Anne Clendening

  • “Nobody stays recovered unless the life they have created is more rewarding and satisfying than the one they left behind.” - Anne Fletcher

  • “The goal isn’t to be sober. The goal is to love yourself so much that you don’t need to drink.” – Unknown

  • “Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.” - J.K. Rowling, author

  • “Being a drug addict in recovery is actually a great place to be because you’re forced to be looking at the rancid layers of the onion that you’ve been carrying around for a lifetime. Whatever degree of struggle it offers me, I’m actually grateful for. It keeps me working towards change, it gives me the desire for change” - Anthony Kiedis

  • “If you can quit for a day, you can quit for a lifetime.” - Benjamin Alire Saenz

  • “Recovery is not simple abstinence. It’s about healing the brain, remembering how to feel, learning how to make good decisions, becoming the kind of person who can engage in healthy relationships, cultivating the willingness to accept help from others, daring to be honest, and opening up to doing.” - Debra Jay

  • “The initial journey towards sobriety is a delicate balance between insight into one's desire for escape and abstinence from one's addiction,” Debra L. Kaplan

  • “All the suffering, stress, and addiction comes from not realizing you already are what you are looking for.” – Jon Kabat-Zinn

  • “Job one is get out of that cave. A lot of people do get out but don't change. So the thing is to get out and recognize the significance of that aggressive denial of your fate, come through the crucible forged into a stronger metal.” - Robert Downey Jr
  • “Addiction is an adaptation. It’s not you–it’s the cage you live in.” - Johann Hari, writer

  • “Don't pick up a drink or drug anymore. I realized I wasn't going to live up to my potential, and that scared the hell out of me. I thought, 'Wow, I'm actually gonna ruin my life. I'm really gonna ruin it.’” - Bradley Cooper, actor and filmmaker

  • “People who go through rehab or a halfway house walk a tough road together and not all of them make it. We knew we faced a powerful adversary that demanded respect. Unlike combat, the adversary was inside us.” - Rob Delaney

  • “Getting sober was the single bravest thing I’ve ever done, and will ever do, in my life. Being courageous enough to acknowledge it privately with my family and friends. Working really hard at solidifying it, getting support around it, and being healthy.” - Jamie Lee Curtis

  • “I don't drink or do drugs anymore. I realized I wasn't going to live up to my potential, and that scared the hell out of me. I thought, 'Wow, I'm actually gonna ruin my life. I'm really gonna ruin it.’” - Bradley Cooper, actor and filmmaker

  • “I got sober. I stopped killing myself with alcohol. I began to think: ‘Wait a minute – if I can stop doing this, what are the possibilities?’ And slowly it dawned on me that it was maybe worth the risk.” ― Craig Ferguson
  • “Recovery from addiction requires hard work, a proper attitude, and learning skills to stay sober, not drinking alcohol or using other drugs. Successful drug recovery or alcohol recovery involves changing attitudes, acquiring knowledge, and developing skills to meet the many challenges of sobriety.” – Dr. Dennis Daley

  • “One of the hardest things was learning that I was worth recovery.” – Demi Lovato

  • “Not all addictions are rooted in abuse or trauma, but I do believe they can all be traced to painful experience. A hurt is at the center of all addictive behaviors.” – Gabor Mate

  • “Addiction is a serious disease; it will end with jail, mental institutions, or death.” – Russell Brand

  • “Never underestimate a recovering addict. We fight for our lives every day in ways most people will never understand.”

  • “You’re not responsible for your disease, but you are responsible for your behavior.”

Best Cities To Live In USA

Author:

Larasati Natasha (intern)

item.title: Stray Kids
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Stray Kids Hyunjin Officially Announced As the Global Brand Ambassador of Versace

The Italian luxury house has appointed Hyunjin from boy band Stray Kids as its new global brand ambassador.

Stray Kids' Hyunjin Becomes Versace's Global Brand Ambassador

Hyunjin of Stray Kids is set to be the face of Versace Holiday 2023 ad campaign, releasing in November.

Versace, Italian luxury brand

Versace is a brand known for its iconic designs and luxury styling. This brand has chosen Hyunjin to represent their brand on a global scale.

The decision highlights that K-pop artists can influence. It also has an impact on the global fashion industry.

Versace announces Korean K-Pop sensation Hyunjin of ‘Stray Kids’ as Global Brand Ambassador.

“I am delighted Hyunjin is joining the Versace family. I am constantly inspired by new voices defining culture around the world and for me Hyunjin has great new energy and creativity. I… pic.twitter.com/vzSBgYNJn9

— VERSACE (@Versace) July 20, 2023

As a member of Stray Kids, Hyunjin is known for his incredible talent, charisma, and sense of style. That makes it the right choice to represent a luxury Italian brand.

“I’m so excited to be starting my Versace journey as a global ambassador and to make beautiful moments together,” said Hyunjin, per WWD.

“I am both inspired and honored to play a part in the house’s truly amazing heritage, and that Donatella [Versace] believes I have the Versace attitude. I’m filled with anticipation and can’t wait to experience the artistic synergy with her.”

"He is a true Versace man.” said Donatella Versace, according to NME.

“I am delighted Hyunjin is joining the Versace family,” added Donatella Versace, the brand’s chief creative officer.

Stray Kids fans and fashion fans look forward to collaboration projects and campaigns.

With Hyunjin's global influence and Versace's elegance, this collaboration promises to charm audiences worldwide.

item.title: Life Struggle Quotes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
44 Life Struggle Quotes to Light Your Way Through Life's Challenges

Life is an unpredictable journey. Peaks of joy and valleys of struggle mark life. We often discover the strength we never knew we had in the depths of hardship.

44 Life Struggle Quotes to Light Your Way Through Life's Challenges

In the tapestry of reality, challenges are not struggling blocks but stepping stones. Let these life struggle quotes guide us towards growth and resilience. As we navigate the complex pathways of life, the wisdom in this life struggle quotes serve as a call. These magic words illuminate the darkness and provide comfort in times of difficulty.

These life struggle quotes are crafted by thinkers and dreamers who have experienced life's storms. These timeless words offer deep insights into the art of diligence and the beauty that can arise from challenging moments.

Here are some life struggle quotes to inspire you, compiled from numerous sources, Friday (17/11/2023).

1. “We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.” – Martin Luther King

2. “Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.” – Confucius

3. “A comfort zone is a wonderful place, but nothing ever grows there.”

Life Struggle Quotes

4. “Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.” — Napoleon Hill

5. “We must meet the challenge rather than wish it were not before us.” – William J. Brennan, Jr.

6. "To have striven, to have made the effort, to have been true to certain ideals – this alone is worth the struggle." – William Osler

7. “Life is like photography. You use the negatives to develop.” – Ziad K. Abdelnour

8. "Look at my success. I didn’t achieve it overnight. It has been the product of many years’ struggle, and every year, my times have shown gradual improvement." – Mo Farah

9. “The probability that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter us from the support of a cause we believe to be just.” – Abraham Lincoln

10. "In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.” –Albert Einstein

11. “I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.” – Louisa May Alcott

12. “When life knocks you down, try to land on your back. Because if you can look up, you can get up.” – Les Brown

Life Struggle Quotes

13. “The triumph can’t be had without the struggle.” – Wilma Rudolph

14. “We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.” – Kenji Miyazawa

15. “The only person you should strive to be better than is the person you were yesterday.” –Tony Robbins

16. “Life is a circle of happiness, sadness, hard times, and good times. If you are going through hard times, have faith that good times are on the way.”

17. "You’re imperfect, and you’re wired for struggle, but you are worthy of love and belonging." — Brene Brown.

18. “It’s not that I’m so smart, it’s just that I stay with problems longer.” – Albert Einstein

19. “Instead of wishing you were someone else, be proud of who you are. You never know who was looking at you wishing they were you.”

20. “When hardships keep coming back, do not take it personal. It’s just life.” – Naide P Obiang

21. “Life keeps throwing me stones. And I keep finding the diamonds…” – Ana Claudia Antunes

22. "The probability that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter us from the support of a cause we believe to be just." – Abraham Lincoln

23. “Attitude-flexibility is the mentality that helps us to smoothly persevere through turbulent times.” – Dr. Jacinta Mpalyenkana

24. "Once all struggle is grasped, miracles are possible." — Mao Zedong

Life Struggle Quotes

25. “Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.” – Albert Einstein

26. “If you are going through hell, keep going.” – Winston Churchill

27. “If someone is strong enough to bring you down, show them you are strong enough to get back up.” – A. Josland

28. “In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.” – Albert Einstein

29. “New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings.” – Lao Tzu

30. "Those who do not move, do not notice their chains." – Rosa Luxemburg

31. “The greatest glory in living lies not in never failing, but in rising every time we fail.” – Nelson Mandela

32. “Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” – Winston Churchill

33. “Your willingness to look at your darkness is what empowers you to change.” –Iyanla Vanzant

34. "Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle."

35. “Be someone’s strength. Be someone’s inspiration. Be someone’s reason to never give up.”

Life Struggle Quotes

36. “Be kind to yourself while you still heal from all that remains unsaid.” –Shreya Maurya

Life Struggle Quotes

37. "Every adversity, every failure and every heartache carries with it the seed of an equivalent or a greater benefit.” –Napoleon Hill

38. “Never regret something that once made you smile.” – Amber Deckers

39. “There are far, far better things ahead than anything we’ve left behind.” –C.S. Lewis

40. “Let perseverance be your engine and hope your fuel.” – H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

41. "The probability that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter us from the support of a cause we believe to be just." — Abraham Lincoln.

42. "To have striven, to have made the effort, to have been true to certain ideals — this alone is worth the struggle." — William Osler

43. “The first step to greatness is believing that greatness exists within you.” – Channique Nathan

44. "Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win." — Bernadette Devlin

In the symphony of reality, each struggle contributes to the melody of strength. Life struggle quotes are not only words; they are lanterns that light our way through the labyrinth of challenges. We can reflect on the timeless wisdom shared by those who have faced hardship and triumphed. Let us embody the truth that struggle is not a sign of loss but proof of our power for growth.

By welcoming life's challenges with an open heart and a spirit, we find the strength to endure and the ability to transform. So, let these life struggle quotes echo bravery and inspiration. These words will accompany you on your journey, lighting your way through life's challenges. These life struggle quotes remind you of the potential for a brighter tomorrow.

item.title: most beautiful towns in America
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
The 8 Most Beautiful Towns in America You Should Visit

Are you planning a trip to America and looking for more than just big cities? The most beautiful towns in America offer unique experiences that you won't find in places like New York or Los Angeles.

The United States is not only about its famous urban centers; it also boasts many charming small towns that showcase different aspects of the country, from serene beaches to majestic mountains. These towns provide a glimpse into the heart of America, where you can enjoy local culture and natural beauty.

If you want to discover the true charm of America, visiting some of its most beautiful towns is a must. Here are eight amazing small towns that will make your trip unforgettable.

1. Girdwood, Alaska

Girdwood is a small town surrounded by stunning mountains and forests. It is famous for its ski resort, Alyeska, which attracts many in winter. In summer, enjoy hiking and discovering beautiful wildflowers. The town has a friendly atmosphere with local shops and restaurants. Girdwood also offers amazing views of the Northern Lights, making it a great place for nature lovers to experience the beauty of Alaska.

2. Taos, New Mexico

Taos is known for its rich culture and vibrant art scene. This town features beautiful adobe buildings and breathtaking views of the mountains. Explore art galleries and enjoy local festivals throughout the year. Close by is Taos Pueblo, a UNESCO World Heritage site where you can learn about Native American history. The unique blend of nature and culture makes Taos a must-visit destination.

3. Nantucket, Massachusetts

Nantucket is an island town famous for its charming streets and beautiful beaches. With many historic buildings and lighthouses, it tells the story of its past as a whaling port. Stroll or bike around the island to enjoy scenic views and fresh seafood from local restaurants. Nantucket also has unique shops where you can find special gifts. It's an ideal place for a relaxing getaway.

4. Sedona, Arizona

Sedona is renowned for its red rock formations and stunning landscapes. This town is a popular spot for hiking, biking, and photography. Many come to Sedona for its spiritual energy and wellness retreats. The vibrant art community adds to its charm with galleries and festivals throughout the year. Sedona's natural beauty makes it one of the most picturesque towns in America.

5. Leavenworth, Washington

Leavenworth is a Bavarian-style village located in the Cascade Mountains. The town features colorful buildings and traditional German festivals like Oktoberfest. Enjoy outdoor activities such as hiking and river rafting in summer or skiing in winter. Leavenworth's unique architecture and lively events create a fun atmosphere perfect for families and friends.

6. Carmel-by-the-Sea, California

Carmel-by-the-Sea is known for its stunning coastline and artistic community. The town has beautiful beaches, charming cottages, and art galleries that attract many visitors each year. Stroll along the beach or explore the nearby Point Lobos State Natural Reserve for breathtaking views of nature. Carmel's European feel adds to its appeal as one of America's most beautiful towns.

7. Ketchikan, Alaska

Ketchikan is known as the "Salmon Capital of the World." This coastal town features colorful wooden houses built on stilts over the water. Enjoy fishing, kayaking, or exploring nearby islands by boat. Ketchikan also has a rich Native American culture with totem poles and art galleries showcasing local crafts. Its scenic beauty makes it an excellent destination to explore.

8. Cody, Wyoming

Cody is named after the famous frontiersman Buffalo Bill Cody and offers a glimpse into the Wild West with rodeos and cowboy culture. Explore museums that celebrate Western history or go hiking in nearby Yellowstone National Park for unforgettable experiences in nature. Cody's friendly atmosphere and rich heritage make it an exciting destination for anyone interested in American history.

item.title: milan
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
The 7 Best Free Things to Do in Milan for Budget Travelers

Milan is Italy's fashion capital and a beautiful city full of amazing places to visit. Many people think Milan is expensive, but there are many wonderful things you can do without spending money. You can explore historic buildings, beautiful parks, and famous shopping areas completely for free.

The city offers many free activities that show its rich culture and history. From stunning churches to peaceful gardens, Milan has something special for every traveler. These free attractions let you experience the real spirit of this amazing Italian city without worrying about your budget.

Here are seven fantastic free places and activities in Milan that will make your trip memorable. Each location offers unique experiences and beautiful sights that cost nothing to enjoy.

1. Visit the Beautiful Duomo di Milano

The Duomo di Milano is Milan's most famous landmark built over six centuries, starting in the 14th century. This huge Gothic cathedral sits in the heart of the city center. Entry to the main cathedral is free for prayer and worship, allowing you to see the colorful stained glass windows and marble floors inside. You can admire thousands of statues on the outside walls and countless spires reaching toward the sky with intricate Gothic details.

2. Window Shopping at the Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II

The Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II opened in 1877 and is one of the world's oldest shopping malls. This elegant glass-covered gallery has a beautiful iron and glass roof that creates natural light during the day. You can walk on the mosaic floor featuring emblems of Italian cities like Milan, Turin, Florence, and Rome. The gallery houses luxury brands like Prada, Louis Vuitton, Versace, and historic Caffè Biffi for window shopping and people-watching.

3. Enjoy the Beautiful Garden of Castello Sforzesco

Castello Sforzesco was built in the 15th century by the Sforza family who ruled Milan. The castle grounds feature large free gardens with fountains, walking paths, and green lawns perfect for relaxing. You can explore the medieval walls, towers, and courtyards without paying entrance fees. While the castle houses several exciting museums that require tickets, the gardens include beautiful rose gardens, a peaceful pond, and comfortable benches where you can rest while watching ducks.

4. Walk Around the Navigli

The Navigli district features historic canals that once carried marble for building the Duomo and were improved by Leonardo da Vinci in 1482. Today, you can stroll along Naviglio Grande and Naviglio Pavese to discover charming courtyards, vintage boutiques, and independent bookstores. Visit the weekly antique market on the last Sunday of each month or browse local artists selling handmade crafts and paintings. The colorful canal-side buildings create perfect photo opportunities, and you can watch street artists creating new murals throughout the area.

5. Relaxing at the Parco Sempione

Parco Sempione is Milan's largest park behind Castello Sforzesco and was designed as an English-style garden in 1888. The park features the tall Torre Branca tower, a peaceful artificial lake called Laghetto, and the impressive Peace Arch monument. You can walk along tree-lined paths with beautiful plane trees, elms, and horse chestnuts providing shade. The park also offers free outdoor fitness equipment and hosts regular outdoor art exhibitions and cultural events during warm summer months.

6. Visit the Cimitero Monumentale

The Cimitero Monumentale opened in 1866 and is a massive outdoor art museum with thousands of graves and elaborate monuments. This unique cemetery features sculptures by famous Italian artists including Medardo Rosso and Giò Pomodoro. You can follow the free map to find notable graves like composer Giuseppe Verdi's family tomb and writer Alessandro Manzoni's memorial. The cemetery has different sections including Jewish, Orthodox, and Catholic areas, each showcasing unique architectural styles and memorial traditions from various historical periods.

7. Spend Time At Piazza Gae Aulenti

Piazza Gae Aulenti opened in 2012 and is named after Italian architect Gae Aulenti who designed this modern masterpiece. This circular pedestrian square sits elevated above street level and features the impressive Unicredit Tower, Milan's tallest building. The square has geometric water fountains that create beautiful light displays at night and offers free WiFi for visitors. You can sit on the wide stone steps and enjoy the spectacular LED light shows that illuminate the surrounding skyscrapers like Bosco Verticale every evening.

item.title: Kim Yoo Jung
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Kim Yoo Jung is The Most Beautiful Korean Actress in Their 20s by Japanese Fans

In the second and third positions are Han So Hee and Suzy.

Kim Yoo Jung is The Most Beautiful Korean Actress in Their 20s by Japanese Fans

On the 16th, a Japanese site called 'Rankingoo' shared a list of the most beautiful Korean actresses in their 20s.

They said that the top spot belonged to Kim Yoo Jung.

Kim Yoo Jung used to be a child actress. Now, she has become a charming adult actress.

In the second and third positions are Han So Hee and Suzy. They are an actress and actress-singer.

This survey involved 2,175 people, ranging from teenagers to those in their 40s, as reported by Allkpop.

People on the internet are saying good things about Kim Yoo Jung.

"She is very strong in Korean dramas, especially historical dramas,"

"I became a fan because she is very cute,"

"Her beauty looks like it's from a painting."

They also talk about her big eyes and smile, making her look innocent.

Kim Yoo Jung became famous for her role in the drama 'Love in the Moonlight.'

She plays Hong Ra On, who dresses up like a eunuch. She has a love story in the palace with Lee Yeong (played by Park Bo Gum).

This drama is loved by many people in Korea, with the highest viewership of 23.3%.

Kim Yoo Jung received much attention recently because of her beauty in the drama 'My Demon' with Song Kang.

People overseas really like their chemistry. The way the drama was made was also widely praised.

Kim Yoo Jung's next project is to appear in a special episode of the Netflix drama 'Chicken Nugget.' This drama will air on March 15.

She plays Min-ah, who turns into a chicken nugget after getting into a strange machine.

The story is about her father, Seon Man (played by Ryu Seung Ryong), and Baek Jung (played by Ahn Jae Hong), who secretly likes Min-ah, trying to find her.

item.title: dave grohl
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Facts About Dave Grohl Foo Fighters Chewing the Same Gum for 26 Years

Facts About Dave Grohl Foo Fighters Chewing the Same Gum for 26 Years

Foo Fighters frontman and former Nirvana drummer Dave Grohl admitted that he has been chewing the same piece of Trident spearmint-flavored gum for the past 26 years.

“Anyone that’s been to a Foo Fighters gig probably noticed that I’m constantly chewing gum. But only true fans that get very close to my mouth will know that it’s been the same piece of gum for over two decades,” said Grohl.

“This gum is part of the reason we’ve been so successful. I was chewing it while we wrote all our biggest hits, and it still has a hint of flavor, so I can’t justify wasting it. My dentist says the gum’s tar-like texture from years of chewing is the reason that all my teeth are loosening up, but this gum isn’t going anywhere. Keep rockin.”

Multiple sources reported that Grohl isn’t the only musician who loves chewing gum during performances.


“When I first saw Dave chew his way through the chorus of ‘Big Me,’ I knew there had to be something about this whole gum thing,” explained Green Day singer Billie Joe Armstrong.

“Green Day was in a collapse, so I asked Dave if I could try it, and he gave me half of his piece. Two days later I had written ‘American Idiot’ and already started mapping out the Broadway show. This gum is infused with something special. Someday I hope to pass it along to a deserving multi-millionaire musician.”

Historian Trey Underwood said he believes Grohl’s gum should be collected in an exhibit in the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.

“I’ve been working with the museum staff to make sure we have someone on the scene as soon as Mr. Grohl dies in order to extract the gum and keep it preserved,” said Underwood.

“I tried striking a deal with him by suggesting we would induct the Foo Fighters into the Hall of Fame as soon as we got the gum, but he didn’t go for it. So now we have to do this the hard way. But we are committed to ensuring that future generations can appreciate the piece of gum Grohl picked off the dashboard of his V8 Ford Falcon van every morning during his early days of touring.”

As of press time, sales of Trident spearmint gum had rocketed among 15- to 25-year-olds who were trying to learn how to play “Everlong” to impress their girlfriends.

item.title: k-pop
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
History of K-Pop Lightsticks and Became Important Merchandise at Concerts

History of K-Pop Lightsticks and Became Important Merchandise at Concerts

You won't be surprised to see a group of fans carrying lightsticks every time a K-pop music concert is held.

Because lightsticks are not ordinary merchandise, they become a symbol of fan identity and pride at every K-pop music concert.

More than that, lightsticks are also a combination of beauty and technology.

Unlike now, being a fan of idol groups in the past did not recognize lightsticks.

In the late 1990s, during the era of the first generation, K-pop fans wore raincoats and held balloons to support their favorite groups.

The two most prominent groups back then were H.O.T. and Sechskies, where H.O.T. fans wore white raincoats and held white balloons.

While Sechskies fans wore yellow raincoats.

The hit Korean drama Reply 1997 hilariously depicted the fierce rivalry between the two fandoms.

Later, second-generation K-pop fans no longer wore raincoats but held balloons in their group's official colors to support their idols.

TVXQ, for example, held a red balloon, and SS501 held a green balloon.

Later, in 2006, BigBang became the first K-pop group to launch an official lightstick.

BigBang's leader, G-Dragon, designed a yellow crown-shaped lightstick called BangBong to make their V.I.P. (BigBang fans) stand out from the crowd.

G-Dragon is also said to have created the lightstick because they wanted to see their fans from the stage. Usually, only the stage looks bright, while the fan section is dark.

YG then became the first company to mass-produce K-Pop lightsticks; the rest is history.

Today, lightsticks have evolved and have advanced features such as Bluetooth connectivity, color-changing capabilities, and even being used as charging ports.

These technological upgrades make them an integral part of the live concert experience.

Lightsticks can be synchronized with the performance to create a stunning visual spectacle.

The transformation of lightsticks from simple tools to complex, personalized devices mirrors the evolution of KPop itself.

Lightsticks only gained mainstream popularity in the second generation of K-Pop. Now, almost all idol groups have their own lightsticks with various unique shapes and names.

Although it can provide beauty during concerts, there have been light moments in the dark side of the K-pop world.

Black Ocean, this was a particularly tough moment for K-pop groups, as they were forced to perform in complete darkness and silence.

This is the most radical method fans use to show they do not support a band.

Some famous groups have experienced this, such as Twice or BTS in 2016.

Yes, the most famous bands in the world have experienced this.

item.title: Indian Police Arrest A Pigeon Bird Because They Think It Is A Chinese Spy!
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Indian Police Arrest A Pigeon Bird Because They Think It Is A Chinese Spy!

Indian Police Arrest A Pigeon Bird Because They Think It Is A Chinese Spy!

An Indian pigeon, suspected of being a Chinese spy, has been released after eight months in custody.

Authorities in Mumbai found the bird with Chinese writing on its wings. However, the bird was proven to be a lost Taiwanese racing pigeon!

The pigeon was held at Bai Sakarbai Dinshaw Petit Hospital for Animals and released last week in good health.

Animal rights group PETA helped secure its release, saying that pigeons, like all birds, should be free to fly.

Experts believe the racing pigeon got lost during a race off Taiwan and may have hitched a ride to India.

But Indian's suspicion is not without reason. Pigeons have historical use in reconnaissance operations during wars.

Despite the seeming absurdity, pigeon racing is a popular sport, but critics raise concerns about the well-being of the birds involved.

item.title: Funny Dog Jokes For Kids
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
40 Funny Dog Jokes For Kids That Guaranteed Young Comedians Laugh

Let's grab your pup, sit back, and enjoy the comedy show! These puns and one-liners will surely make you chuckle.(Photo by Blue Bird on pexels)

40 Funny Dog Jokes For Kids That Guaranteed Young Comedians Laugh

Are you looking for a way to brighten your child's day with laughter? Look no further! We've compiled a list of 40 Funny Dog Jokes For Kids.

These words will be guaranteed to make young comedians giggle. From paws-itively hilarious puns to tail-wagging one-liners, these jokes will make your little ones laugh at the floor.

Let's grab your furry friend and get ready to unleash the fun!








Funny Dog Jokes For Kids

1. What do you get when you cross a dog with a phone? A mobile bark-ing device!

2. Why did the dog sit in the shade? Because he didn't want to be a hot dog!

3. How does a dog stop a video? He hits the paws button!

4. What do you call a cold dog ? A chili dog!


5. Why did the dog go to school? To get a little "ruff" around the edges!

6. How do you know if a dog is having a good time at the park? He's wagging his tail off!

7. What do you call a dog magician? A labracadabrador!

8. Why did the dog go to the doctor ? Because he had a "ruff" case of fleas!

9. What did the dog say to the tree? Bark!

10. How do dogs stay cool in the summer? They pant-tastic!

11. Why was the dog such a good musician? Because he had perfect "paw"s!

12. What did the dog say when he sat on sandpaper? Ruff! 13. Why did the dog bring a pencil to the park? In case he needed to "draw" some attention!

14. What do you call a dog who loves karate? A roundhouse pupper!

15. Why did the dog go to school with a ruler? To measure up to his classmates!

16. How does a dog clean his house? With a vacuum "fur" cleaner

Funny Dog Jokes For Kids

18. Why was the dog such a great baseball player? Because he had a good "fetch" game!

19. How do you know if a dog has been using your computer? You find "paws" in the search history!

20. What did the dog say to his pillow? " You may be fluffy, but you'll never be as soft as me!"

21. Why did the dog sit in front of the computer? He wanted to keep an eye on the mouse!

22. How does a dog stop a movie? He hits the paws button!

23. What do you call a dog who loves to swim? A doggy paddler!

24. Why did the dog chase his own tail? He wanted to make ends meet!

25. What kind of dog loves to take baths? A shampoo-dle!

26. Why did the dog bring a ladder to the bar? He heard the drinks were on the house!

27. How do you make a hot dog stand? Take away its chair!

28. Why did the dog cross the road twice? To fetch a bone on the other side!

29. What do you call a dog who loves to play hide and seek? Where's the Woof!

30. Why did the dog bring a map to the park? In case he got lost in his "woof-woof" world!

31. How does a dog make phone calls? He uses his "collar-ID"!

Funny Dog Jokes For Kids

32. What do you call a dog who loves to dance? A disco dachshund!

33. Why did the dog go to school with a calculator? To improve his "paw-sitive" math skills!

34. How do dogs communicate during a game of hide and seek? They use their bark code!

35. What did the dog say to the tree after it scratched its back? Thanks for being a good "bark" scratcher!

36. Why did the dog bring a pencil to the party? In case he needed to "draw" attention!

37. How does a dog stop a TV show? He hits the paws button!


38. What do you call a dog who loves to tell jokes? A bark comedian!

39. Why did the dog go to school with a backpack ? To fetch his lunch!

40. What do you call a dog who loves to read? A bookworm terrier!

Funny Dog Jokes For Kids

Let's grab your pup, sit back, and enjoy the comedy show! Are you a dog lover or enjoy a good joke? These puns and one-liners will surely make you chuckle.

These 40 Funny Dog Jokes For Kids will bring smiles and laughter to your little ones.

item.title: Hawaii
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Top 5 Most Haunted Places in Hawaii to Make You Scream

Hawaii is famous for its breathtaking natural beauty and warm hospitality. It also has a darker side that creeps within its history and legends. Oahu is Hawaii's richest and most picturesque island. It is not just a tropical sun, sand, and surf paradise. Under its breathtaking beauty lies a darker side—a world of ghostly apparitions, creepy encounters, and scary tales.

Top 5 Most Haunted Places in Hawaii to Make You Scream

For those with a taste for the supernatural, Oahu offers many haunted places to make you scream. In this article, we will explore the most haunted places in Hawaii.

Oahu, Hawaii, with its rich history and cultural heritage. It is a ground for paranormal activity. It ranges from old sacred sites to historic landmarks. The island is filled with stories of restless spirits and unexplained phenomena. Prepare to be delighted and terrified as we travel through the most haunted places in Oahu, Hawaii.

Are you a believer in ghosts or treat the paranormal with skepticism? Hawaii's haunted places have a mysterious aura. It has intrigued locals and visitors for generations. From shadowy figures and mysterious whispers to puzzling cold spots and unexplained apparitions.

These locations leave brave souls shaking with fear. Join us as we uncover the ghostly secrets of Oahu, Hawaii.

Discover the dark tales that have become a part of history. Brace yourself, for what lies ahead will test your bravery. Get ready to scream as we embark on the most haunted places in Hawaii.

Kawaiaha'o Church is a historical and architectural gem. It is considered one of Hawaii's most haunted places. It is located in downtown Honolulu. There is a neighboring graveyard. It's where many famous Hawaiian figures are buried.

1. Kawaiaha'o Church and Graveyard

flickr/Jimmy Emerson, DVM

Kawaiaha'o Church and Graveyard

It is said to be a hotbed of supernatural activity. Visitors have reported seeing ghosts and hearing disembodied voices. They also feel unexplainable dread exploring the grounds after dark.

It is nestled among the majestic cliffs of the Ko'olau Mountains on Oahu. The Pali Lookout offers breathtaking panoramic views of the island. But, under its scenic beauty lies a haunting history. Legend has it that this place was the battleground for a fierce battle in ancient times. It is said that the spirits of fallen warriors stay in the area. Visitors have reported hearing ghostly cries and experiencing sudden temperature drops. They also feel a supernatural presence that chills them to the bone.

2. The Pali Lookout

Iolani Palace in Honolulu carries a rich history and regal charm. It is the ex-residence of Hawaiian monarchs. But, some believe that past rulers' spirits continue to walk the palace halls.

3. Iolani Palace

Visitors have reported seeing ghosts dressed in royal clothing. They also hear phantom footsteps echoing through empty corridors. Some feel an unexplainable sense of unease as they explore the rooms of this majestic palace.

The Hawaii Plantation Village Museum proves the island's sugar plantation era. It is located on the island of Oahu. This museum offers a glimpse into the lives of immigrants who worked under harsh conditions. Many believe that the spirits of these laborers still haunt the village.

4. Hawaii Plantation Village Museum

Visitors reported sightings of ghostly figures and strange sounds. Some also hear unexplained footsteps reported by visitors. The residual energy of their hardships stays. Their spirits create a spooky atmosphere throughout the village.

Old wheelchair in infirmary, Hawaii's Plantation Village

The Aloha Tower is an iconic landmark with a haunted past. It stands tall in Honolulu Harbor. It is said that a young woman's spirit still exists at that site. She is known as "The Lady in Red," and haunts the tower.

5. Aloha Tower

Local legends say she tragically died in a fall from the tower. But now she wanders the area in search of her lost lover. Visitors have reported encountering her ghostly presence. They also feel sudden wind blows and hear disembodied voices whispering in the night.

Haunted Places in Hawaii

Hawaii's stunning landscapes and rich cultural heritage. They hold supernatural tales within them. The top five haunted places in Hawaii—Kawaiaha'o Church and Graveyard, The Pali Lookout, Iolani Palace, Hawaii Plantation Village Museum, and Aloha Tower—each have their own scare stories. Many reported paranormal encounters.

Are you a skeptic or a believer? Exploring these haunted places will surely chill your spine. They will make you question the line between the living and the spirits in Hawaii's mystical. Remember, when visiting these haunted places, be prepared for the unexpected. You'll never know what ghostly awaits you in the land of aloha.
