This horror-comedy is filled with humor and heart-pounding action. "Thriller" follows a group of survivors navigating a zombie apocalypse. Watch it on Netflix.

These pandemic and virus-themed movies present a mix of suspense, drama, and adrenaline-pumping thrills.

They will have you marveling at the screen from start to finish.

Are you a horror, science fiction, or action film fan? There's something for everyone on this list of pandemic and virus-themed movies. Let's grab some popcorn, dim the lights, and prepare for a cinematic journey into worlds overrun by infectious chaos!

Pandemic and Virus-Themed Movies

item.title: reading
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Is it True That Reading in the Dark Can Damage Your Eyes? Here’s the Explanation!

Have you often heard that reading in the dark can damage your eyes? This widely known myth often worries people when they read in low light. But is it true that reading in the dark can cause permanent damage to your eyes? Or is it just a myth without any scientific basis?

While reading in poor light won't cause permanent eye damage, this habit can still have some long-term effects that we should be aware of. Let’s take a closer look.

What Happens to the Eyes when Reading in the Dark?

Reading in a dark or dimly lit place can make your eyes work harder than usual. In these conditions, your pupils widen to try to capture more light, which can lead to quick eye fatigue. This can result in symptoms like dry eyes, blurred vision, and headaches. But what happens to our eyes when we read in low light?

The human eye can adjust to different light levels, a process known as light adaptation. When in a dark place, the eyes adjust by opening the pupils wider to let in more light.

However, your eyes exert more energy to focus on the text or objects you are looking at, which can cause strain on the eye muscles. If this continues for a long time, it can lead to a condition known as eye strain.

Myth or Fact: What Does the Research Prove?

Several studies have been conducted to determine if reading in the dark can harm your eyes. The results are quite surprising. According to Dr. James Sheedy, an eye health expert at Pacific University College of Optometry, reading in dim or dark light does not cause permanent damage to the eyes. This is also confirmed by the American Academy of Ophthalmology, which states that no scientific evidence shows that reading in low light can damage the eye's structure or lead to blindness.

Another study published in the Journal of Optometry and Vision Science found that while the eyes may work harder and become more fatigued in low light conditions, this does not lead to permanent damage or long-term vision problems.

In fact, in many cases, the eye strain from reading in dark or poorly lit areas is temporary and can be relieved with rest or a change in position.

Symptoms of Eye Fatigue from Reading in the Dark

Although reading in the dark does not cause permanent damage to the eyes, this habit can lead to some symptoms that make the eyes feel uncomfortable. Here are some common symptoms that may occur from reading in low light:

1. Eye Strain

When the eyes have to work harder to focus in low light, tension in the eye muscles can result. This may result in pain, fatigue, and tension around the eyes and forehead.

2. Dry Eyes

We tend to blink less often when we focus on objects in dim light. This can lead to dry, irritated, and red eyes.

3. Headaches

Eye strain from reading in the dark can trigger headaches. This usually happens because the eye muscles are tense and working hard to see clearly.

4. Blurred Vision

When the eyes struggle to see clearly in insufficient light, we might experience blurred vision or difficulty focusing, which is usually temporary.

Long-term Effects of Reading in the Dark

In general, reading in the dark won't cause permanent damage to your eyes or lead to blindness. However, the long-term effects may include decreased visual comfort.

Repeated eye strain can lead to more frequent discomfort, and in more serious cases, it could contribute to vision problems like myopia (nearsightedness) or astigmatism. It's important to note that conditions like myopia are usually caused by genetic factors or other bad habits, such as staring at screens from a close distance too often.

So, while reading in the dark doesn't cause myopia, excessive eye strain from poor habits can still affect our vision quality over time.

If you need to read in dim or dark light, here are some tips to help protect your eye health.

First, you'll need to use a bright reading lamp and direct the light onto your reading object. Using a lamp that is too dim or bright can cause eye strain.

Second, your reading position is very important. Please ensure that the distance between your eyes and the book is comfortable and not too close. Remember to give your eyes regular breaks by following the 20-20-20 rule: every 20 minutes of reading, look away for 20 seconds at something about 20 feet away. If you have vision problems, wear the correct glasses or contact lenses to reduce strain.

Lastly, try not to read for too long at one time to avoid tiring your eyes. Following these tips lets you keep your eyes healthy while enjoying reading in a dimmer environment.

item.title: 8 Strangest Facts About Planet Mercury
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
8 Strangest Facts About Planet Mercury

8 Strangest Facts About Planet Mercury

Mercury, the smallest planet in our solar system, may be tiny, but it's packed with weirdness that set it apart. Let's dive into some of the strangest facts about this fast-moving world in our cosmic neighborhood.

Swipe Up to Learn More!

No Air, Crazy Temperatures

Unlike Earth, Mercury doesn't have much air. This makes it super hot during the day (800°F or 427°C) and freezing at night (-290°F or -179°C).

Slow Spin, Fast Orbit

Mercury spins slowly, taking 59 days to turn once. But it zips around the sun in just 88 days.

Big Sun View

If you were on Mercury when it's close to the sun, the sun would look three times bigger than from Earth.

Strange Crater Patterns

The Caloris Basin, a big hole on Mercury, has weird patterns called "hollows" caused by heat making things disappear.

Iron Core Center

Mercury has a big iron core (85% of the planet), creating a strong magnetic field, making it a magnet powerhouse.

Hot Outside, Cold Ice Inside

Despite its hot surface, Mercury has ice in cold craters near the poles.

Magnetic Confusion

Mercury's magnetic field is off-center, confusing scientists as it's not where they expected.

Getting Smaller

Over time, Mercury is shrinking as its iron core cools, making wrinkles and scarps on the surface. It's the only planet with these changes in our solar system.

item.title: potato jokes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
100 Potato Jokes: Spud-tacular Puns That Will Make You Laugh

Are you looking for a good laugh today? Potato jokes might be just what you need. These silly and fun jokes can make anyone smile, no matter their age. If you enjoy simple humor, these jokes are a great way to brighten your day.

Potato is one of the most popular foods in the world. People cook it in many ways—boiled, fried, mashed, or baked. However, these common vegetables can also become the star of hilarious jokes. Potato jokes are light, easy to understand, and often make people laugh because they are so relatable.

If you are looking for some simple and silly jokes to brighten your day, you have come to the right place. In this article, we have collected some hilarious potato jokes from various sources, Wednesday (2/7/2025). Check out these funny jokes and get ready to laugh out loud.

The Funniest Potato Jokes

1. What's a potato's favorite horror movie? The Silence of the Yams.

2. Which disease is the biggest killer of potatoes? Tuber-culosis.

3. What do you call a potato that's reluctant to jump into boiling water? A hesi-tater.

4. What do you call a fake potato? An imi-tater.

5. What do you call a potato that's always looking for a fight? An agi-tater.

6. Why did the potato cross the road? He saw a fork up ahead.

7. What do you call a potato at a football game? A spec-tater.

8. What do you call a spinning potato? A rotate-o.

9. What do you call a good-looking french fry? A hot potato.

10. What do you call a lazy spud? A couch potato.

11. What do you call a stolen yam? A hot potato.

12. What do you call a yam with a broom? A sweep potato.

13. Why was the potato taken to a psychiatric hospital? It was starch raving mad.

14. What do you call a lethargic baby kangaroo? A pouch potato.

15. What do you call a chip with glasses? A spec-tater.

16. What's a potato's favorite TV show? Starch Trek.

17. What do you call potatoes with right angles? Square roots.

18. What do you call a person who spends a lot of time sitting and staring at potatoes? A medi-tater.

19. What do you call a chip that makes fun of you? A tater-taunt.

20. Why do potatoes make good detectives? Because they keep their eyes peeled.

21. What do you call a first aid vehicle made out of potatoes? A yambulance.

22. What's a potato's least favorite dance? The Mash Potato.

23. What is a potato's life philosophy? I think, therefore I yam.

24. What do you call a passenger train made out of sweet potatoes? A Yamtrack.

25. What kind of potato would Kim Jong Un be? A dic-tater.

Hilarious One-Liner Potato Jokes

1. I couldn't ask for a better friend; you're a real "chip" off the old block.

2. Why did the potato sit alone at lunch? It was feeling mashed.

3. What do you call a potato that's reluctant to grow up? A "small fry."

4. I'm so "baked," I'm practically a potato.

5. I told my potato it was hot, and now it's really buttering me up.

6. Don't go "tater" with me, I'm on a roll.

7. This joke is so good, it'll have you in "starch."

8. No one "peels" a joke quite like me.

9. I'm "smashed" after that joke!

10. Why didn't the potato want his daughter to marry the news reporter? Because he was a commen-tater.

11. Life's not always easy, but at least I'm "spud"tacular.

12. He's got some serious "potato-tential."

13. This joke's "fried" to perfection.

14. I "dig" potato jokes, they're really "rooted" in humor.

15. When it comes to jokes, I'm "chip" off the old block.

16. Why don't potatoes ever argue? Because they always know how to "ketchup"!

17. I love mashed potatoes, but only if they're well-seasoned… I just can't handle bland spuds.

18. I'm not a fan of potato jokes, but I guess you could say I'm a "mash" for them.

19. There's nothing quite like a good potato joke to "chip" away at a bad mood.

20. All potato puns are pomme de terrible.

21. How do you know a potato is in a bad mood? When they're acting salty.

22. Why does everyone love sweet potatoes? They're yammy.

23. Why does everyone love cooking with potatoes? They're very a-peeling.

24. What do you use to carry potatoes? A tater tote.

25. What did the sweet potato say to the regular potato? "I yam what I yam".

Silly Potato Jokes for Kids

1. What do you call a baby potato? Small fry.

2. What did the father potato say to his daughter before her football game? I'm rooting for you.

3. Why did the potato salad blush? Because it saw the salad dressing.

4. What do potatoes eat for breakfast? Pota-toast with jelly.

5. What instrument does a spud play? A "tuber."

6. What do you get when you put an elephant and a load of potatoes together? Mashed potatoes.

7. How does a potato win at Street Fighter? By mashing the kick button.

8. What do you get when you cross a tater with a race car? Crashed potato.

9. What does a potato say on a sunny morning? What a mashing day!

10. Why shouldn't you give a zombie mashed potatoes? Because they're already a little grave-y.

11. What do you get after a potato rainstorm? Spuddles.

12. What's a potato's favorite song to dance to at a Halloween party? The "Monster Mash."

13. What's the difference between pea soup and mashed potatoes? Anyone can mash potatoes, but no one can pea soup.

14. Why did the French fry win the race? Because it was fast food.

15. How did the burger propose to the fry? With an onion ring?

16. Why can't a farmer keep secrets on her farm? Because the corn has ears, the potatoes have eyes and the beans stalk.

17. What do you call a french dog that loves potatoes? A pomme de terrier.

18. Why did the sea monster eat twelve ships that were carrying potatoes? Because nobody can eat just one potato ship!

19. How did the Irish potato become bilingual? He became a French Fry.

20. What is the difference between a hot potato and a flying pig? One's a heated yam, and one's a yeeted ham.

21. Why did the potato cross the road? To get to the "mash" side!

22. What do you call a potato that likes to play music? A "rock" star!

23. Why are potatoes bad at playing hide and seek? Because they always "peel" under pressure!

24. What's a potato's favorite TV show? "The Spud-y Bunch!"

25. What do you get when you cross a potato with a vampire? A "fright-tato"!

Funny Baked Potato Jokes

1. Why did the baked potato stay home? Because it was a couch potato!

2. What do you call a potato that's afraid to jump? A scaredy-spud!

3. How do you know if a potato is happy? It's chipper!

4. Why did the potato break up with the sweet potato? It couldn't handle the heat!

5. Why did the potato go to the doctor? It had a bad case of starchness!

6. What did the potato say to the butter? "You're on a roll!"

7. Why did the potato go to school? To become a french fry-ture!

8. What do you call a potato that's a singer? A spud-tacular performer!

9. Why did the potato turn red? Because it saw the salad dressing!

10. How do you fix a broken potato? With a potato patch!

11. What's a potato's favorite horror movie? The Spud-shank Redemption!

12. Why did the potato get an award? For being a-peeling!

13. What do you call a potato that's a comedian? A pun-tato!

14. Why was the potato so happy? It was in its element!

15. What do you call a potato that's good at math? A square root vegetable!

16. Why did the potato go to outer space? To find the universal tuber!

17. Why did the potato go to the beach? To get a tan-tato!

18. What do you call a potato that's a detective? Sherlock Spuds!

19. How does a baked potato answer the phone? "Alo-tater!"

20. Why did the baked potato refuse to go to the party? It didn't want to get mashed up in the crowd!

21. What did the baked potato say to the sweet potato? "You're a-peeling to me!"

22. How does a baked potato keep its skin looking good? It uses a lot of eye-cream!

23. What do you call a baked potato at a football game? A spectator spud!

24. How do you know when a baked potato is angry? It's all steamed up!

25. What do you get when you cross a baked potato with an owl? A spud hoot!

item.title: home alone 2
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Home Alone 2 House in New York Sold for $6.7 Million

Home Alone 2 House in New York Sold for $6.7 Million

The house used as the filming location for Home Alone 2: Lost in New York is on sale for US$6.7.

Based on a USA Today report, the house is located on the Upper West Side at 51 West 95th Street. The house is flanked by Central Park West and Columbus Avenue.

The contents of this house are different from the contents of the house seen in the movie Home Alone 2. The house now consists of four bedrooms and four and a half bathrooms.

It also features a kitchen, a garden, a wine cellar, and a snack bar.

The house also has high ceilings and walnut wood floors, enhanced with two bay windows.

This is the New York townhouse used as one of the filming locations for Home Alone 2: Lost in New York. In the movie, this house belongs to Kevin's uncle Rob.

After being separated from his family on vacation, Kevin, the character played by Macaulay Culkin, faces the Sticky Bandits duo.

The Sticky Bandits are a thieving duo of Harry (Joe Pesci) and Marv (Daniel Stern). They try to break into Kevin's vacationing family's house.

Kevin defeats Harry and Marv by setting traps in many corners of the house.

It's been over 20 years since the house became known as one of the iconic locations for the movie Home Alone. However, until now, the house still has "fans".

According to The Townhouse Experts™, Dexter Guerrieri and Nicole Kats of Vandenberg, the owners still get letters from children addressed to the townhouse.

In addition, many people still take photos in front of the house as a keepsake.

Home Alone 2: Lost in New York is a sequel to the first movie released in 1992. It is a comedy movie that is often shown at Christmas.

Macaulay Culkin is still the lead for the second Home Alone movie, along with Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Tim Curry, Brenda Fricker, and Catherine O'Hara.

item.title: Gigi Hadid
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Reportedly Dating with Bradley Cooper, Here is Gigi Hadid’s Dating History

Let's see Hadid's romances over the years!

Reportedly Dating with Bradley Cooper, Here is Gigi Hadid’s Dating History

Gigi Hadid and Bradley Cooper are reportedly dating. They were spotted together in New York City twice in the last several days, as reported by PEOPLE.

Three days after dinner in New York City, they were snapped on Sunday.

The super model riding in the same car, with Cooper, 48, behind the wheel.

Previously, Gigi Hadid was in a relationship with Zayn Malik. They separated in 2021.

This 28-year-old supermodel has also dated another famous male artist.

Let's see Hadid's romances over the years!

Hadid and Leonardo DiCaprio were linked in September 2022. The news spread after they were seen hanging out at New York Fashion Week after-party. According to Page Six, the couple "wasn't serious yet."

In February 2023, they were not seen together again for several months.


An insider told US Weekly three months later that DiCaprio and Hadid "have a nice situation."

In September 2023, people believed they were "no longer together."

Gigi Hadid and Zayn Malik started dating in 2015. Hadid even starred in the music video for "Pillowtalk" in 2016.

According to Us Weekly, in April 2020, the couple was expecting their first child. They welcomed their daughter Khai in September 2020. The media confirmed in October 2021 that Hadid and Malik had split for good.

© trstdly 2023

Tyler Cameron started dating Hadid in July 2019. They appeared together at the 2019 MTV Video Music Awards afterparty. Us Weekly confirmed that their romance ended in October 2019.

Hadid was first related to Formula 1 World Champion Lewis Hamilton in 2015. They were spotted sitting together at the amfAR Gala that year.

Jonas met Hadid for the first time at the Grammy Awards when he was just 13 years old. Their romantic journey only started in June 2015 and ended in November of the same year. After breaking up, Hadid started dating Zayn Malik.

Hadid first met Cody Simpson, Australian singer, in 2013. Hadid appeared in his music video for "Surfboard." The couple started dating in 2013 and broke up in 2014. They reunited a few months later. But they split again in May 2015.

item.title: Peru
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
5 Historical Places in Peru: Discover the Timeless Beauty

Peru is a land of ancient civilizations and rich cultures. Peru Invites travelers with a timeless charm that transcends the ages.

5 Historical Places in Peru: Discover the Timeless Beauty

A wealth of historical treasures awaits discovery among its fantastic landscapes and lively cities. Join us on a journey through five historical places that unveil Peru's charming past. We will transport you through the history of time.

Let's check out five historical places in Peru compiled from numerous sources on Monday (14/08/2023).

1. Machu Picchu: The Crown Jewel of the Inca Civilization

Machu Picchu is a marvel of Inca engineering and architecture. Machu Picchu is proof of the creativity of a civilization that thrived in the Andean highlands.

Photo: pexels-amanda-kerr

Machu Picchu is perched atop the mist-covered mountains. This iconic fortress whispers the tales of ancient people's mastery of their environment. Wander through its terraced gardens, intricate stone structures, and holy temples. Visitors can feel the heartbeat of a civilization that once ruled the heights.
pexels-pixabay

Lima's Huaca Pucllana Site Museum offers a charming window into the prehistoric world that predated the modern city. This pyramid is an architectural marvel from Lima culture.

2. Huaca Pucllana Site Museum: Lima's Prehistoric Past

The museum stands as a silent witness to the passage of centuries. Visitors can explore its labyrinthine passageways and courtyards.

Let the whispers of the past resonate in your soul. You may feel the rituals and daily life of those who once called it home.

Historical Places in Peru

3. Cuzco Main Square: Heartbeat of an Empire

Cuzco's Main Square is also known as Plaza de Armas. It is proof of the blend of Inca and Spanish influences that shaped Peru's history. Decorated colonial buildings surround Cuzco Main Square.

Photo: pexels-augusto-baldera

Also, with the remains of ancient Inca walls, the square exudes a magnetic charm. Engage yourself in the lively energy of this historical hub. There is tradition and modernity combined in a harmonious dance.

Photo: pixabay/leonardotani

High above Cuzco is the monumental fortress of Saqsaywaman. This fort reigns as a majestic relic of Inca prowess.

4. Saqsaywaman: The Citadel of Giants

Gigantic stone blocks, exactly carved and fitted together. These create a fantastic panorama that fights for time.

Saqsaywaman stands among the towering walls and sees the majesty of a civilization. It shaped the Andean landscape with masterful precision.
Photo: pexels-agustina-montanaro

5. Chan Chan: City of Sand and Sun

Venture north to the desert coastline. You'll uncover Chan Chan. It is the capital of the Chimu Kingdom. This vast adobe city was once a thriving center of commerce and culture.

Photo: pinterest_Costamar

Chan Chan tells the story of a society complex linked to the sea. Explore its detailed mazes, ceremonial plazas, and rising walls. Visitors can live in a city where artistry and architecture are combined with the ocean.
Photo: flickr/Enrique Daniel Salazar

Historical Places in Peru

In a world that runs forward, Peru's historical places offer relaxation. They invite travelers to follow old civilizations' footsteps and trace the evolution of cultures. It ranges from the heights of Machu Picchu to the sun-kissed walls of Chan Chan. Each site has a chapter in Peru's rich narrative. These places invite you to be a part of a tale that bridges the past and present. Let them whisper their secrets to your heart as you explore these historical treasures. They will remind you of the lasting beauty in every stone and story.

item.title: Movies About Astronauts
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Top 7 Movies About Astronauts For Astronomy Lovers

Top 7 Movies About Astronauts For Astronomy Lovers

For all the astronomy enthusiasts out there, there's no better way to fuel your passion for space exploration than by watching movies about astronauts.

These films offer a captivating glimpse into the thrilling world beyond our planet. So, grab some popcorn and get ready for a cosmic adventure as we present to you the best astronaut movies of all time!

1.2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)

- IMDb: 8.3
- Rotten Tomatoes: 92%
- Available on: Max, Fandango at Home, Prime Video, Apple TV

2001: A Space Odyssey

Directed by Stanley Kubrick, this iconic science fiction film takes viewers on a mind-bending exploration of human evolution and the mysteries of the universe. The plot follows a voyage to Jupiter with the sentient computer HAL after the discovery of a mysterious black monolith affecting human evolution.

2. Apollo 13 (1995)

- IMDb: 7.7
- Rotten Tomatoes: 96%
- Available on: Fandango at Home, Prime Video, Apple TV

Apollo 13

Based on the true events of the Apollo 13 mission, this gripping drama recounts the harrowing story of three astronauts stranded in space after a critical malfunction occurred onboard their spacecraft. With the lives of the astronauts hanging in the balance, NASA engineers work tirelessly to bring them safely back home.

3. Gravity (2013)

- IMDb: 7.7
- Rotten Tomatoes: 96%
- Available on: Fandango at Home, Prime Video, Apple TV

Gravity

Starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney, this intense and visually stunning film tells the story of a medical engineer and an astronaut who find themselves adrift in space after their shuttle is destroyed. As they struggle to survive amidst the vastness of space, the movie takes viewers on a thrilling and emotional journey.

4. Interstellar (2014)

- IMDb: 8.7
- Rotten Tomatoes: 73%
- Available on: Paramount+, Fandango at Home, Prime Video, Apple TV

Interstellar

Directed by Christopher Nolan, this epic space opera depicts a future where Earth is becoming uninhabitable. A group of explorers embarks on a journey through a wormhole to find a new habitable planet. The movie is celebrated for its stunning visuals, complex storytelling, and emotional depth.

5. The Martian (2015)

- IMDb: 8.0
- Rotten Tomatoes: 91%
- Available on: Fandango at Home, Prime Video, Apple TV

The Martian

Based on the novel by Andy Weir, this science fiction film follows the story of an astronaut who becomes stranded alone on Mars after his crew mistakenly believes him to be dead and leaves him behind. With limited supplies and his ingenuity, he must find a way to survive and signal for rescue.

6. Ad Astra (2019)

- IMDb: 6.5
- Rotten Tomatoes: 83%
- Available on: Fandango at Home, Prime Video, Apple TV

Ad Astra

Starring Brad Pitt, this introspective sci-fi thriller follows an astronaut as he embarks on a mission across space to uncover the truth about his missing father and a threat that could endanger the entire solar system. The movie explores themes of isolation, human connection, and the vastness of space.

7. The Right Stuff (1983)

- IMDb: 7.8
- Rotten Tomatoes: 96%
- Available on: Fandango at Home, Prime Video, Apple TV

The Right Stuff

Based on Tom Wolfe's book, this historical drama chronicles the early days of the United States' space program. It delves into the lives of the first astronauts, known as the "Mercury Seven," as they undergo rigorous training and testing to become the pioneers of human space exploration.

item.title: 8 World’s Most Beautiful Female Volleyball Players
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
8 World’s Most Beautiful Female Volleyball Players

8 World’s Most Beautiful Female Volleyball Players

Discover the incredible talent of female volleyball players from around the globe! From Kazakhstan to Brazil, these athletes showcase skill, determination, and passion on the volleyball court. Let's explore the achievements of these gorgeous female athletes as they make their mark in the world of volleyball.

Brenda Castillo (Dominican Republic)

A skilled libero from the Dominican Republic, Brenda has been a vital player for her national team. She participated in the 2012 Summer Olympics, contributing to her team's success.

Nataliya Goncharova (Russia)

Nataliya is a talented attacker for the Russian national team. Although she has some weaknesses in defense and passing, she excels in attack and has won awards like the MVP of the 2016 FIVB World Grand Prix.

Sheilla Castro (Brazil)

A key player for Brazil, Sheilla is known for her charming personality and strong physical abilities. She is highly skilled in both attacking and blocking, making her one of the top opposite hitters in the game.

Sabina Altynbekova (Kazakhstan)

Born on November 5, 1996, in Kazakhstan, Sabina is a skilled volleyball player known for her tall height and model-like appearance. She gained attention by representing Kazakhstan in the Asian Cup Youth Women’s Volleyball Tournament in 2014.

Saori Kimura (Japan)

Hailing from Japan, Saori is a well-known volleyball player with a successful career both in high school and on the national team. After competing in multiple Olympics, she retired in 2016.

Tijana Bošković (Serbia)

Born in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Tijana is a prolific scorer for the Serbian women's national volleyball team. She has achieved success in various international tournaments and continues to shine with her club team.

Winifer Fernandez (Dominican Republic)

Another gorgeous volleyball player from Dominican Republic, Winifer is a standout libero recognized for her exceptional skills on the court. She has played for various teams in her home country and continues to make an impact in the sport.

Zehra Güneş (Turkey)

Representing Turkey, Zehra is a rising star in women's volleyball, playing as a middle blocker. She has showcased her talent at both club and international levels.

item.title: brachycephalic
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
7 Cute Flat-Faced Cat Breeds You’ll Fall in Love With

Flat-faced cats, also known as brachycephalic breeds, are adored for their unique appearance and sweet personalities. Their round faces, short noses, and large eyes give them an irresistibly cute look. These cats often seem like they’re wearing a permanent expression of curiosity or calmness, which adds to their charm.

While these breeds are undeniably adorable, it’s important to understand that their flat faces can sometimes lead to health issues. Breathing difficulties, dental problems, and the need for regular grooming are common challenges. However, with proper care and attention, these cats can live happy and healthy lives as loving companions.

If you’re considering adding a flat-faced cat to your family or just want to learn more about them, here are six of the most popular breeds. Each has its own unique personality and traits that make them special.

1. Persian

The Persian is one of the most iconic flat-faced cat breeds. Known for their luxurious long fur and sweet disposition, Persians are the ultimate lap cats. They love relaxing in quiet environments and enjoy being pampered by their owners. However, their thick coats require daily brushing to prevent tangles and mats. Persians are also gentle and affectionate, making them great companions for families or individuals looking for a calm pet.

2. Himalayan

Himalayan cats are a mix between Persian and Siamese breeds, combining the best traits of both. They have the Persian’s flat face and long fur but feature Siamese-like color points on their ears, face, paws, and tail. Himalayans are laid-back and affectionate cats that enjoy lounging around the house. They require regular grooming to keep their coats silky and clean but reward their owners with endless cuddles.

3. British Shorthair

The British Shorthair is a sturdy breed with a dense coat and a calm temperament. These cats are independent yet loving, making them perfect for busy households or first-time cat owners. Their round faces and plush fur give them an irresistibly cuddly appearance. British Shorthairs adapt well to indoor living and are easy to care for compared to other flat-faced breeds.

4. Scottish Fold

Scottish Folds are famous for their folded ears and round faces, which give them an owl-like look. These medium-sized cats are friendly, social, and get along well with children and other pets. They have a soft coat that comes in various colors and patterns. While they’re generally easy-going, it’s important to be aware of potential joint issues caused by their genetic traits.

5. Exotic Shorthair

Often called the “short-haired Persian,” Exotic Shorthairs share many traits with their long-haired cousins but have a dense, plush coat that’s easier to maintain. They are playful yet calm cats that enjoy spending time with their families. Exotics have large eyes and flat noses that make them look perpetually curious or sleepy—adding to their charm.

6. Selkirk Rex

The Selkirk Rex stands out with its curly fur, giving it a teddy bear-like appearance. This breed is affectionate and sociable, thriving in homes where they receive plenty of attention from their humans. Selkirks are known for being patient and tolerant, making them great pets for families with children or other animals. Their unique curly coats require occasional grooming to keep them looking their best.

item.title: Most Haunted Houses In Salem
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
6 Most Haunted Houses In Salem, MA, To Get Whispers of the Past

6 Most Haunted Houses In Salem, MA, To Get Whispers of the Past

Salem, Massachusetts, is known for its dark witch trials and haunting history.

The city is filled with stories of ghosts and spirits that still linger in some of its oldest buildings. If you're a fan of the supernatural or curious about the past, you'll want to check out these six haunted houses in Salem, MA.


Most Haunted Houses In Salem, MA

1. The Witch House (Jonathan Corwin House)

The Witch House is one of the most well-known haunted houses in Salem.

Judge Jonathan Corwin owned it before. He played a role in the Salem Witch Trials of 1692. Visitors have said they hear whispers and footsteps in the house. Some have reported seeing apparitions of figures from the past.

2. The Turner-Ingersoll Mansion

The Turner-Ingersoll Mansion is also known as the House of the "Seven Gables." It is another haunted location in Salem.

This historic house was made famous by Nathaniel Hawthorne's novel of the same name.

Visitors have reported feeling a sense of unease and seeing shadowy figures throughout the mansion.

Most Haunted Houses In Salem, MA

flickr/ctulrich073090

3. The Joshua Ward House

The Joshua Ward House is said to be haunted by the ghost of Sheriff George Corwin. He was responsible for carrying out executions during the witch trials. People have reported seeing his ghostly figure wandering the halls of the house and hearing mysterious footsteps and whispers.

wikipedia

4. The Haunted Pickman House

The Pickman House is rumored to be haunted by the spirits of ex-residents who met tragic ends. Visitors have reported feeling a sense of dread and unease while inside the house and seeing objects move on their own.

5. The Ghosts of Grimshawe House

The Grimshawe House is another haunted location in Salem. This historic house is said to be haunted by the spirits of the Grimshawe family.

They tragically died in a fire that destroyed the house many years ago. Visitors have reported hearing ghostly laughter and seeing shadowy figures moving throughout the house.

6. The Haunted Rope Mansion

The Ropes Mansion is one of the oldest houses in Salem.

It is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of Abigail Ropes, an ex-resident who died under mysterious circumstances. Visitors have reported hearing her footsteps echoing through the halls and feeling a chilling presence in certain house rooms.

These 6 haunted houses in Salem, MA, are filled with history and whispers of the past that continue to this day.

Are you a believer in the supernatural or just looking for a spooky adventure? These spots are sure to send chills down your spine. So, if you're ever in Salem, visit these haunted houses. Let's see, you may catch a peek at the spirits that still roam within their walls. Who knows what secrets and stories they may have to share with those brave enough to listen.

Most Haunted Houses In Salem, MA

item.title: avocado recipes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
4 Avocado Recipes: Easy, Tasty, and Healthy

Avocados are one of the most loved fruits around the world. They are creamy, tasty, and full of healthy fats that make you feel good. When you search for avocado recipes, you will find many different ways to enjoy this amazing fruit. People love avocados because they are easy to use and make any meal better.

Avocados are not just tasty, they are also very healthy for your body. They have good fats that help your heart stay strong and give you energy. Avocado recipes are perfect for people who want to eat better food without giving up great taste. These green fruits also have vitamins and minerals that make your skin look good and help your body work well.

In this article, you will learn four easy avocado recipes that anyone can make at home. From the classic avocado toast to the creamy avocado smoothie, these recipes are perfect for those looking for an easy, tasty, and healthy dish to add to their menu.

Avocado Toast With Egg Recipe

Avocado toast with egg is a perfect breakfast that gives you protein and healthy fats to start your day. This recipe is filling and takes only ten minutes to make from start to finish.

Ingredients:

- 2 slices of bread (whole grain works best)

- 1 ripe avocado

- 2 eggs

- 1 tablespoon of lemon juice

- Salt to taste

- Black pepper to taste

- 1 tablespoon butter or oil for cooking

- Optional: red pepper flakes, fresh herbs

Instructions:

1. Start by toasting your bread slices in a toaster or toaster oven until they become golden brown and crispy. The bread should be firm enough to hold both the avocado and egg without breaking, but not too hard to bite.

2. While the bread is toasting, heat a small pan over medium heat and add the butter or oil. Make sure the pan is not too hot, or the eggs will cook too quickly and become tough.

3. Crack the eggs into the heated pan carefully, one at a time. Cook them sunny-side up for about three to four minutes, until the egg whites are completely set but the yolks are still soft and runny. You can also scramble the eggs if you prefer them that way.

4. While the eggs are cooking, cut your avocado in half by running a knife around the middle of the fruit. Twist the two halves apart and remove the large seed in the center. Use a spoon to scoop out all the green flesh into a medium bowl.

5. Add the lemon juice to the avocado and mash everything together with a fork. You can make it as smooth or as chunky as you like. The lemon juice helps keep the avocado fresh and adds a nice tangy flavor that goes well with eggs.

6. Season your mashed avocado with salt and black pepper. Taste it and add more seasoning if needed. The mixture should taste fresh and flavorful, and will complement the richness of the eggs.

7. Spread the avocado mixture evenly on your toasted bread slices. Use a spoon or knife to make sure every part of the bread has avocado on it. The avocado creates a creamy base that helps hold the egg in place.

8. Carefully place one cooked egg on top of each avocado toast. If you made sunny-side up eggs, be gentle so you don't break the yolk. Season the eggs with a little more salt and pepper, and sprinkle red pepper flakes or fresh herbs on top if you like extra flavor.

Healthy Avocado Salad Recipe

This fresh avocado salad is perfect for lunch or as a side dish with dinner. It combines many healthy vegetables with creamy avocado for a satisfying meal.

Ingredients:

- 2 ripe avocados

- 1 large cucumber

- 2 medium tomatoes

- 1/4 red onion

- 2 tablespoons olive oil

- 1 tablespoon lime juice

- 1 teaspoon salt

- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper

- Fresh cilantro (optional)

Instructions:

1. Wash all your vegetables under cold running water and dry them with a clean towel. Clean vegetables are important for food safety and better taste.

2. Cut the avocados in half, remove the seeds, and scoop out the flesh. Cut the avocado into small cubes, about the size of your thumbnail. Try to make all pieces the same size so the salad looks nice and cooks evenly.

3. Peel the cucumber and cut it into small pieces that match the size of your avocado cubes. Remove the seeds from the cucumber if they are large, as they can make the salad watery.

4. Cut the tomatoes into small pieces, removing the stem area. If the tomatoes have too much juice, you can remove some of the liquid parts to keep your salad from becoming too wet.

5. Slice the red onion very thin. If you find raw onion too strong, you can soak the sliced onion in cold water for ten minutes, then drain it. This makes the onion taste milder.

6. Put all the cut vegetables in a large bowl. Add the olive oil, lime juice, salt, and black pepper. Mix everything gently with a large spoon, being careful not to mash the avocado pieces.

7. Let the salad sit for ten minutes before serving. This allows all the flavors to mix together. Add fresh cilantro on top if you like the taste of herbs.

The Best Guacamole Recipe

Guacamole is a classic Mexican dip that makes any party or meal more fun. This recipe creates a smooth and flavorful dip that everyone will love.

Ingredients:

- 3 ripe avocados

- 1 small lime (juiced)

- 1 small white onion

- 2 small tomatoes

- 2 cloves of garlic

- 1 jalapeño pepper (optional)

- 1 teaspoon salt

- 1/2 teaspoon cumin

- Fresh cilantro

Instructions:

1. Choose avocados that feel slightly soft when you press them gently. They should not be too hard or too mushy. Cut each avocado in half, remove the seed, and scoop the flesh into a large mixing bowl.

2. Squeeze the lime juice directly over the avocado flesh. Use a fork or potato masher to mash the avocados until you get the texture you want. Some people like smooth guacamole, while others prefer it chunky with small pieces.

3. Dice the white onion into very small pieces. The smaller you cut the onion, the better it will mix with the avocado. If you don't like strong onion flavor, use less onion or soak it in cold water first.

4. Remove the seeds from the tomatoes and cut them into small cubes. Add the diced tomatoes to your mashed avocado mixture. The tomatoes add freshness and color to your guacamole.

5. Mince the garlic cloves very finely, or use a garlic press if you have one. Add the garlic to the bowl along with the salt and cumin. These spices give the guacamole its authentic Mexican flavor.

6. If you like spicy food, remove the seeds from the jalapeño pepper and chop it very small. Add it to the mixture bit by bit, tasting as you go. You can always add more, but you cannot take it out.

7. Chop the fresh cilantro and add it to the guacamole. Mix everything together gently but thoroughly. Taste your guacamole and add more lime juice, salt, or spices if needed.

8. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, pressing it directly onto the surface of the guacamole to prevent browning. Let it rest in the refrigerator for at least thirty minutes before serving.

Creamy Avocado Smoothies Recipe

This avocado recipe is a healthy and delicious way to start your day or enjoy as an afternoon snack. The avocado makes the smoothie very creamy without adding dairy.

Ingredients:

- 1 ripe avocado

- 1 banana

- 1 cup milk (dairy or plant-based)

- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup

- 1/2 cup ice cubes

- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)

- Pinch of salt

Instructions:

1. Make sure your avocado is ripe and creamy. Cut it in half, remove the seed, and scoop the flesh into your blender. A ripe avocado will make your smoothie much creamier and more delicious.

2. Peel the banana and break it into smaller pieces before adding it to the blender. Frozen banana pieces work well too and make the smoothie thicker and colder.

3. Pour the milk into the blender with the fruits. You can use any type of milk you prefer - cow's milk, almond milk, soy milk, or oat milk all work well in this recipe.

4. Add the honey or maple syrup for sweetness. Start with less sweetener and add more if needed after you taste the smoothie. Different fruits have different levels of natural sweetness.

5. Add the ice cubes to make your smoothie cold and refreshing. If you used frozen banana, you might need less ice. The ice also helps make the smoothie thicker.

6. Add the vanilla extract and a small pinch of salt. The salt might seem strange, but it helps bring out all the other flavors in the smoothie.

7. Blend everything on high speed for about sixty seconds, or until the mixture is completely smooth and creamy. Stop the blender and check the consistency. If it's too thick, add more milk. If it's too thin, add more avocado or banana.

8. Taste your smoothie and adjust the sweetness or flavors as needed. Pour into glasses and serve immediately while cold. You can garnish with a slice of avocado or banana on the rim of the glass.

item.title: Most Popular Traditional Games From India
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Top 5 Most Popular Traditional Games From India

India is a country with rich and diverse cultures and traditions. Beyond its bustling cities, India has a lot of fun games that people have loved for a long time. These games are not like the video games we have today, but they are still loved by many.

Top 5 Most Popular Traditional Games From India

In this article, we will uncover some of the most popular traditional games from India.

For a very long time, these games have been loved by people of all ages, from children to adults alike.

1. Kabaddi

Kabaddi is a team sport that is popular all over India. It is a type of tag game. The game is played between two teams, each has 7 players. (Photo: Ramakrishna Math and Ramakrishna Mission on Flickr/Public Domain)

One player of one of the teams will be an attacker. They have to run into the opposing team area and touch as many players as possible without being tackled by the defenders in 30 seconds.

The attacking team will get a point for each player they touch. But if they are tackled by the defenders, the opposing team will score a point. Each player that's been touched is taken out of the game. They can come back in for each point scored by their team.

2. Kho-kho

Kho Kho, one of India's oldest outdoor games, is a thrilling tag-style sport played by two teams of twelve players each. (Image by Ministry of Parliamentary Affairs of India)

The game is played on a rectangular field divided into halves, with one team as attackers and the other as defenders. In the defender's team, nine players take the field, eight sitting on the center line while one becomes the active chaser.

Three players from the attacker's team enter the field, aiming to avoid the chaser's touch or exit the field. The chaser can tag a teammate to take over the role by tapping on his back and shouting "kho" loudly. It's a fast-paced game of strategy and speed!

Kancha or Lakhoti is a traditional Indian game that is played using marbles. The game is played by two or more players. The objective of the game is to knock out the other player's marbles from a circle using your own marble. The game is simple to learn but difficult to master.

3. Kancha or Lakhoti

Gilli Danda is a traditional Indian game that is played using two sticks, a gilli, and a danda. The gilli is a small piece of wood that is about the size of a cricket ball. The objective of the game is to hit the gilli as far as possible using the danda.

4. Gilli Danda

5. Carrom

Carrom is a very popular game in India and many other parts of the world. It is a two-player game that is played on a square board with four pockets at each corner. (Image by PDPics from Pixabay)

The game is played using small discs called carrom men and a striker. The goal is to pocket your carrom men and a red queen using the striker. (Image by PDPics from Pixabay)

You score points for each piece you pocket. The first to reach a set number of points wins.

item.title: diet
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
What's Better for Diet and Health: Bread vs White Rice

What's Better for Diet and Health: Bread vs White Rice

Bread and white rice are two foods that are often debated as being better for health.

Foods that are commonly avoided by someone who is on a diet are bread and white rice. Both are often referred to as the main culprits that make it difficult for someone to lose weight.

In terms of health, these two foods are often compared to determine which one is healthier. Some consider white rice to be healthier than bread, while others think the opposite. Is this true?

According to Clearcut-Fitness, a study conducted by Kyoto University in Japan compared the differences in metabolism and gut microbiota in people who consumed a balanced diet consisting of protein sources such as meat, fish, or eggs, vegetables, and carbohydrate sources.

The only difference is the source of carbohydrates used: white bread for one group and white rice for the other group.

This study lasted for 21 consecutive meals. Based on this experiment, the following comparison is known.

What's Better for Diet and Health

Macronutrients

When it comes to macronutrients, bread shows its superiority. Bread contains twice the amount of protein compared to white rice and is low in digestive fiber and fats.

However, it is important to note that even though bread has more protein, the protein in bread is not considered a high-quality protein source because most of the amino acids in bread are non-essential amino acids. However, bread still remains a better choice for weight loss because protein has a higher thermogenic effect than carbohydrates alone. This means that you will burn more calories when eating protein than when eating carbohydrates.

Gut Microbiota

The importance of gut microbiota cannot be ignored. A study has shown that the group consuming white bread has more probiotics than the group consuming white rice. These probiotics are called Bifidobacteria, and research has proven that Bifidobacteria have a positive impact on human health through their metabolic activities.

Nutritional Similarity: Carbohydrates and Fiber

Both bread and white rice are good sources of carbohydrates. Our body uses carbohydrates as a source of energy.

The Importance of Magnesium Content in the Body

When it comes to magnesium content, rice is superior to bread. Magnesium is crucial in the formation of lipids and DNA, as well as the regulation of hormone balance and support for cell communication.

When it comes to choosing between white bread and white rice for diet and health purposes, it is important to consider your goals. If you want to lose weight, bread may be a better choice because its protein and fiber content will keep you feeling fuller for longer.

However, if you are trying to build muscle, both are good choices, with white rice perhaps being more suitable as it increases the necessary calorie intake in a muscle-building diet.

In choosing between the two, it is important to consider the goals and consult with a nutrition expert beforehand.

item.title: Tonkotsu Ramen Recipe
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Tonkotsu Ramen Recipe: Exploring the Richness of 3 Unique Japanese Variants

Tonkotsu Ramen Recipe: Exploring the Richness of 3 Unique Japanese Variants

Tonkotsu ramen is a beloved Japanese dish. It has gained international acclaim for its rich and flavorful broth, toothsome noodles, and an array of delicious toppings. In this article, we will explore three enticing variants of tonkotsu ramen recipes that fill different preferences – the classic Rich and Creamy Tonkotsu Ramen Broth, the plant-based delight of Vegan Tonkotsu Ramen, and the umami-packed Tonkotsu Miso Ramen. Let's check out some ideas for tonkotsu ramen recipes, compiled from numerous sources, on Wednesday (28/12/2023). pixabay/allybally4b

Tips On How To Make Tonkotsu Ramen

Remember, making tonkotsu ramen is a work of love. The effort you put into creating a flavorful broth will be worth it when you savor that first spoonful of delicious homemade ramen. Making tonkotsu ramen at home can be a rewarding culinary experience. Here are some tips to help you achieve a delicious bowl of tonkotsu ramen:

  • Select the Right Bones: Use a combination of pork bones that include trotters, neck bones, and possibly chicken bones for added depth of flavor. Make sure to clean the bones before simmering to remove impurities.

  • Patience is Key: Simmer the broth for an extended period (8-10 hours) to extract maximum flavor. You will achieve the rich, creamy consistency characteristic of tonkotsu ramen.

Tonkotsu Ramen Recipe

  • Frequent Skimming: Skim off any foam or impurities that rise to the surface of the broth during the simmering process. This helps maintain a clear and clean broth.

  • Add Aromatics: Include aromatic ingredients like garlic, ginger, onions, and green onions to enrich the overall flavor profile of the broth.
  • Balancing Flavors: Modify the seasoning towards the end of the cooking process. Add soy sauce, sake, miso paste, and sesame oil gradually, tasting to achieve the desired balance of flavors.

  • Use Quality Noodles: Invest in good-quality ramen noodles.

You can find fresh or dried noodles at Asian grocery stores. Cook them just before serving to maintain their texture.

  • Temperature Matters: Serve the tonkotsu ramen piping hot. The warmth improves the flavors of the broth and ensures that the noodles and toppings are at their best.

  • Vegan or Low-Fat Options: For a lighter version, consider making vegan tonkotsu ramen using vegetable broth, shiitake mushrooms, and soy milk. This provides a creamy texture without the richness of pork.

  • Storage and Reheating: Tonkotsu broth can be pretty gelatinous when refrigerated. Don't be shocked; it's a sign of well-cooked broth. Heat it gently, and it will return to a liquid state.

  • Experiment and Enjoy: Don't hesitate to experiment with tonkotsu ramen recipes. Add your twist to the broth, try different noodle types, or play with unique toppings to make your dish.

Tonkotsu Ramen Recipe

Rich and Creamy Tonkotsu Ramen Broth Recipe

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs pork neck bones
  • 1 lb pork trotters
  • 1 onion, quartered
  • 1 head garlic, halved
  • 2 inches ginger, sliced
  • 2 green onions, roughly chopped
  • 1/2 cup soy sauce
  • 1/4 cup sake
  • 2 tablespoons miso paste
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • Salt to taste

Instructions:

1. Rinse the pork bones and trotters in cold water.

2. Place them in a large pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil.

3. Discard the water, clean the bones, and scrub away any impurities.

4. Return the bones to the pot with fresh water.

5. Add the onion, garlic, ginger, and green onions.

6. Simmer for 8-10 hours, periodically skimming out impurities.

7. Strain the broth and return it to the pot.

8. Stir in soy sauce, sake, miso paste, and sesame oil.

9. Simmer for an additional 30 minutes.

10. Season with salt to taste.

Vegan Tonkotsu Ramen Recipe

Ingredients:

  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup shiitake mushrooms, sliced
  • 1 cup king oyster mushrooms, sliced
  • 1 cup soy milk
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon miso paste
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1 teaspoon grated ginger
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. In a pot, sauté garlic in sesame oil until fragrant.

2. Add shiitake and king oyster mushrooms, and cook until tender.

3. Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.

4. Stir in soy milk, miso paste, soy sauce, and grated ginger.

5. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Tonkotsu Miso Ramen Recipe

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs pork belly, thinly sliced
  • 1 cup red miso paste
  • 4 cups chicken broth
  • 1 tablespoon mirin
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1 tablespoon sugar
  • 1 cup corn kernels
  • 4 packs ramen noodles
  • Green onions and nori for garnish

Instructions:

1. In a pot, sear pork belly until golden brown.

2. Add miso paste and sauté for 2 minutes.

3. Pour chicken broth, mirin, soy sauce, and sesame oil.

4. Add sugar and bring to a simmer.

5. Cook ramen noodles separately according to package instructions.

6. Assemble bowls with noodles, broth, and pork slices.

7. Garnish with corn, green onions, and nori.

Whether you crave the traditional richness of tonkotsu, opt for a vegan alternative, or seek a fusion of flavors with miso, these three tonkotsu ramen recipes fill various tastes.

Experiment with these variations to find the perfect bowl that satisfies your culinary desires. These tonkotsu ramen recipes will transport you to the heart of Japanese comfort food.

Tonkotsu Ramen Recipe

item.title: Horoscope Matches For Libra

item.content:encoded:
6 Horoscope Matches For Libra for Love and Compatibility

6 Horoscope Matches For Libra for Love and Compatibility

Libras are known for their charm, diplomacy, and love of harmony. As an air sign ruled by Venus, Libras often seek balance in all aspects of their lives, including relationships.

If you're a Libra looking for love, you may wonder which zodiac sign best matches you. Here are six horoscope matches for Libra that can lead to love and compatibility:


Horoscope Matches For Libra

pinterest/Abhishek Soni

1. Aquarius (January 20 - February 18)

Aquarius and Libra share a deep intellectual connection and enjoy stimulating conversations. Both signs value independence and freedom in their relationships, making them a great match.

Gemini's playful and adaptable nature complements Libra's friendly and charming personality. Together, they can create a fun and exciting relationship through laughter and communication.

2. Gemini (May 21 - June 20)

pinterest/༺𝒪𝓁𝑒𝓈𝒸𝒽𝑜𝓃𝑜𝓀 ༻

3. Sagittarius (November 22 - December 21)

Sagittarius and Libra love adventure and new experiences. These qualities make them a dynamic duo when exploring the world together. Their shared optimism and positivity create a harmonious bond.

4. Leo (July 23 - August 22)

Leo's confidence and passion match Libra's romantic and loving nature well. Both signs show appreciation for luxury and enjoy being the center of attention. These features make them a powerful couple when it comes to socializing and enjoying life together.

Yes, believe it or not, Libras can also be compatible with their own sign! Two Libras together create a balanced and harmonious relationship. They can understand each other's need for fairness and harmony.

5. Libra (September 23–October 22)

6. Taurus (April 20 - May 20)

Venus, the planet of love and beauty, rules Taurus and Libra. This shared connection creates a strong bond between them. They both respect the finer things in life and value stability in their relationships.

Finding the right horoscope match for a Libra can lead to a fulfilling and loving relationship.

These signs bring something unique to the table that complements Libra's traits and personality. So, if you're a Libra looking for love, explore these horoscope matches to see if one of them could be your perfect partner. Love and compatibility are vital elements in any relationship. Let's think wisely and enjoy the journey of finding your ideal match.

Horoscope Matches For Libra

item.title: Amelia Earhart Quotes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
30 Amelia Earhart Quotes: Inspiring Words to Help You Fly High

30 Amelia Earhart Quotes: Inspiring Words to Help You Fly High

Amelia Earhart was a pioneering aviator and one of the most famous women in history. Known for her daring spirit and fearless attitude, she broke many records and inspired countless people around the world. Her achievements in aviation made her an icon, and her mysterious disappearance in 1937 added to her legend. Amelia Earhart quotes reflect her adventurous life and the wisdom she gained through her experiences.

Born in 1897, Amelia Earhart was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean. She was a trailblazer in a male-dominated field and a role model for women everywhere. Amelia Earhart quotes capture her determination and the barriers she overcame to achieve her dreams.

In this article, we have selected some of the best Amelia Earhart quotes from various sources, Monday (15/7/2024). These quotes will inspire you to fly high and push through the boundaries.

Amelia Earhart Quotes About Flying and Adventure

1. "Flying may not be all plain sailing, but the fun of it is worth the price."

2. "I lay no claim to advancing scientific data other than advancing flying knowledge. I can only say that I do it because I want to."

3. "No borders, just horizons - only freedom."

4. "As soon as we left the ground, I knew I had to fly."

5. "Trouble in the air is very rare. It is hitting the ground that causes it."

6. "Adventure is worthwhile in itself."

7. "After midnight, the moon set, and I was alone with the stars. I have often said that the lure of flying is the lure of beauty, and I need no other flight to convince me that the reason flyers fly, whether they know it or not, is the esthetic appeal of flying."

8. "Not much more than a month ago, I was on the other shore of the Pacific, looking westward. This evening, I looked eastward over the Pacific. In those fast-moving days, which have intervened, the whole width of the world has passed behind us, except this broad ocean. I shall be glad when we have the hazards of its navigation behind us."

9. "My ambition is to have this wonderful gift produce practical results for the future of commercial flying and for the women who may want to fly tomorrow's planes."

10. "The stars seemed near enough to touch and never before have I seen so many. I always believed the lure of flying is the lure of beauty, but I was sure of it that night."

B. Inspirational Amelia Earhart Quotes

1. "Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace."

2. "Women, like men, should try to do the impossible. And when they fail, their failure should be a challenge to others."

3. "A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees."

4. "The most effective way to do it is to do it."

5. "Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries?"

6. "Worry retards reaction and makes clear-cut decisions impossible."

7. "The most difficult thing is the decision to act. The rest is merely tenacity."

8. "Never interrupt someone doing something you said couldn't be done."

9. "Never do things others can do and will do, if there are things others cannot do or will not do."

10. "In soloing — as in other activities — it is far easier to start something than to finish it."

11. "Decide...whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying."

12. "The more one does the more one can do."

13. "Better do a good deed near at home than go far away to burn incense."

14. "The woman who can create her own job is the woman who will win fame and fortune."

15. "The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship."

16. "Being alone is scary, but not as scary as feeling alone in a relationship."

17. "To worry is to add another hazard."

18. "Women must pay for everything. They do get more glory than men for comparable feats, but, they also get more notoriety when they crash."

19. "Experiment! Meet new people. That's better than any college education . . . By adventuring; about, you become accustomed to the unexpected. The unexpected then becomes what it really is . . . the inevitable."

20. "What do dreams know of boundaries"

item.title: children
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
8 Signs of Psychopathy in Children That Parents Need to Know

8 Signs of Psychopathy in Children That Parents Need to Know

As a parent, it is crucial to have a good understanding of your child's development. This includes recognizing potential signs that may indicate mental or behavioral well-being issues in your child.

One condition that may not be considered by many parents is psychopathy in children. Psychopathy is a neuropsychiatric disorder that is often identified in adults, but it turns out that early signs can appear in childhood.

Research has shown that psychopathy in children can be influenced by genetic and environmental factors. In the 1990s, researchers categorized psychopathy into three dimensions: callous-unemotional (CU) traits, grandiose-manipulative (GM) traits, and bold-impulsive (DI) traits.

They found that these three dimensions not only apply to adults but can also be recognized in children. Environmental factors can also play a significant role in the development of psychopathy in children. Parenting is one of the main factors that influence this, where harsh or cold parenting, as well as supportive parenting, can have different effects on a child's development.

Early life experiences can also contribute to signs of psychopathy in children. Experiences such as physical or sexual abuse, or emotional neglect, can result in children who have difficulty showing empathy and have a low sensitivity to the suffering of others.

A number of signs of psychopathy in children can appear early on and need to be understood by parents. According to Mom Junction, here are some signs of psychopathy in children.

Lack of Empathy

One of the signs of psychopathy in children is a lack of empathy. Children with signs of psychopathy often appear to be indifferent to the feelings or suffering of others.

They may not show empathy and have low sensitivity towards what others feel.

According to research, children with signs of psychopathy tend to have less ability to feel empathy and often show a lack of sensitivity towards the suffering and pain of others.

Signs of Psychopathy in Children

Uncontrolled Aggression

Uncontrolled aggression is another sign that needs to be observed. Some children with psychopathic traits may display high levels of aggression, especially when they are angry or feel punished. Their aggression may be difficult to control and can lead to self-harming or harmful behavior towards others.

Extreme Tantrum

Children with signs of psychopathy tend to be difficult to regulate and may frequently display extreme tantrum scenes. Their tantrums may involve acts of violence or destructive behavior. This could be a sign that your child has difficulty managing their emotions effectively.

Chronic Lies

Continuous lying is another sign that needs to be noted. Children with psychopathic tendencies may tend to be dishonest and often engage in chronic lying. They may not feel guilty or remorseful about their lies and can be difficult to catch.

Not Caring about Punishment

Children with psychopathic tendencies often exhibit a lack of concern for punishment. They may not be easily influenced by the punishments or sanctions imposed by parents or other authorities. This can be a sign of challenging behavior to manage.

Able to Captivate Others

Children with psychopathic traits may possess a superficial charm. They may be able to charm others with their manipulative abilities. This can make it difficult for parents or others to see the true signs of psychopathy, as the child may appear very pleasant or entertaining.

Cruelty towards Animals

One concerning early sign is the cruel behavior towards animals. Children who mistreat animals often indicate a lack of empathy and sensitivity towards the suffering of other living beings. This cruelty can be an early indication of more serious behavioral disorders.

Behavior Leading to Criminal Activities

Children displaying signs of psychopathy tend to exhibit behaviors that lead to criminal actions. This may include juvenile delinquency or other antisocial behaviors. Criminal behavior in children should be taken very seriously and requires immediate attention and intervention.

Facing a child who shows signs of psychopathy can be a challenging task for parents.

If you notice several of these signs in your child and are concerned about the possibility of psychopathy, it is important to consult with a child psychologist.

This therapy can help children understand and manage their emotions better, as well as develop necessary social skills.

Treatment for psychopathy in children often involves behavioral therapy or counseling.

item.title: how to pair apple watch to new phone
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
How to Pair Apple Watch to New Phone: With and Without Your Old Phone

Just upgraded to a fresh iPhone and wondering how to pair Apple Watch to new phone? You're not alone. Thousands of Apple users face this exact challenge every day. Transferring your watch might look complicated at first glance, but with the right approach, it's actually quite straightforward.

Opening that new iPhone box brings a mix of excitement and that nagging worry about moving all your digital life over correctly. Your Apple Watch isn't just a timepiece—it tracks your health data, holds your favorite apps, and stores personal settings you've customized over time.

Learning how to pair Apple Watch to new phone correctly will save you time and prevent data loss. This guide will walk you through the process step by step, making it easy to transfer your watch no matter if you still have your old phone or not. We wrote this guide on Friday (28/3/2025).

The Complete Process When You Still Have Your Previous iPhone

First, gather these essentials before starting:

- Your Apple account credentials

- Wi-Fi connection for both iPhones

- Both devices charged to at least 50%

- Your current watch passcode

Now, follow this step-by-step process:

1. Prepare with updates. Get your old iPhone running the latest iOS available. Do the same for your Apple Watch. This preparation step might take up to an hour, so plan accordingly.

2. Secure your health data. Navigate to Settings, tap your name, select iCloud, then See All, and confirm Health is active. Computer backup users should enable encryption to protect health information.

3. Create a full backup. Use either iCloud or your computer to save a complete backup of your old iPhone, which automatically includes your watch data.

4. Configure your new iPhone. When setting up, select the option to restore from your latest backup. If prompted about your watch, ensure it's on your wrist and unlocked before tapping Continue.

5. Complete through the Watch app. With your watch unlocked and worn, open the Apple Watch app on your new iPhone. Follow any confirmation prompts that appear. If "Start Pairing" shows instead, you'll need to unpair your watch first.

After finishing these steps, your watch will fully sync with your new iPhone, bringing over all your personalized settings and data.

Transferring Your Watch Without Access to Your Previous Phone

If your old iPhone is no longer available, follow this alternative approach:

1. Start fresh with your watch. Erase all content to remove the existing pairing link.

2. Prepare your new device. Complete the iPhone setup process and log into your iCloud account. Skip ahead if you've already done this.

3. Initialize pairing. Start the Apple Watch app on your new iPhone and begin the pairing sequence.

4. Access your saved data. Look for available backups in the app. Ensure both devices have the latest updates to see all backup options. Note that some recent activity data might not transfer if it wasn't included in your last backup.

5. Choose your most recent data set. Select the latest backup when prompted. Without any backup, you'll need to configure your watch from scratch.

6. Finalize the connection. Complete all on-screen prompts to finish the setup. Allow several days for all iCloud information to fully appear.

Troubleshooting When Pairing Stops Midway

If the process halts during your iPhone setup, try these recovery steps:

1. Open the Apple Watch app on your new iPhone

2. Navigate to the My Watch section

3. Select All Watches

4. Look for the "Pairing Not Complete" message

5. Ensure your watch is on your wrist and unlocked

6. Tap Finish Pairing to resume the transfer

This will pick up where the process stopped and complete syncing your watch with your new device.

Resolving Frozen Screen Issues During Transfer

If your watch freezes on the Apple logo screen during pairing:

1. Force restart your watch. Press and hold both the Digital Crown and side button simultaneously until the screen goes dark and the Apple logo reappears, then release.

2. Perform a reset. After restarting, press firmly on the screen or hold the Digital Crown, then tap the Reset option.

3. Begin pairing again. Bring your iPhone close to your watch and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the connection.

If health and activity information is missing, here are some things you can do:

- For iCloud users: Verify Health is enabled in iCloud settings on both phones

- For computer backup users: Try recovering from an encrypted backup of your previous iPhone

- Without any backup: Unfortunately, your health records cannot be recovered
