I’m also impressed by your company’s commitment to innovation in the digital space, and I’m excited about the possibility of growing with the organization as it expands its digital presence.”

When discussing your long-term career goals, it’s important to strike a balance between ambition and practicality. Show that you have a clear vision for your career, but also that you’re committed to excelling in the current role. This approach demonstrates both your forward-thinking nature and your dedication to immediate responsibilities, making you an attractive candidate for both current needs and future potential.

Final Tips for Success

As we conclude our comprehensive guide on answering “Why are you looking for a new job?”, here are some final tips to ensure your success in handling this crucial interview question:

1. Be authentic:

o Provide genuine reasons for your job search

o Let your personality shine through in your response

o Avoid giving answers you think the interviewer wants to hear if they’re not true for you

2. Stay positive:

o Focus on what you’re moving towards, not what you’re leaving behind

o Avoid negative comments about your current or past employers

o Express enthusiasm for the new opportunity

3. Be concise:

o Keep your answer brief and to the point (aim for 30-60 seconds)

o Hit the key points without rambling

o Be prepared to elaborate if the interviewer asks follow-up questions

4. Tailor your response:

o Customize your answer for each specific job and company

o Highlight aspects of the new role that particularly appeal to you

o Show how your goals align with the company’s mission and values

5. Practice, but don’t memorize:

o Rehearse your answer to feel comfortable with the key points

o Avoid sounding robotic or overly rehearsed

o Be prepared to adapt your response based on the flow of the conversation

6. Show self-awareness:

o Demonstrate that you’ve reflected on your career path and goals

o Acknowledge areas where you want to grow or improve

o Show how this new opportunity fits into your professional development

7. Be prepared for follow-ups:

o Anticipate potential follow-up questions related to your answer

o Have examples ready to support your points

o Be ready to discuss your long-term career goals in more detail if asked

8. Maintain consistency:

o Ensure your answer aligns with other parts of your application (resume, cover letter)

o Keep your story consistent throughout the interview process

o Be prepared to elaborate on points mentioned in your initial answer

9. End on a forward-looking note:

o Conclude your answer by expressing excitement about the potential opportunity

o Reiterate how the new role aligns with your career aspirations

o Show enthusiasm for contributing to the company’s success

Remember, the key to successfully answering “Why are you looking for a new job?” is to be honest, positive, and strategic. Your response should reflect genuine motivations while also demonstrating how you’d be a valuable addition to the new company. By following these tips and thoroughly preparing your answer, you’ll be well-equipped to make a strong impression and move forward confidently in the interview process.

Conclusion

Mastering the art of answering “Why are you looking for a new job?” is crucial for interview success. This question provides an opportunity to showcase your career goals, demonstrate your value as a candidate, and express your genuine interest in the new position. By understanding the interviewer’s perspective, preparing thoughtful responses, and avoiding common pitfalls, you can turn this potentially challenging question into a chance to shine.

Remember these key points:

• Be honest and positive in your response

• Focus on your professional growth and future aspirations

• Align your answer with the company’s needs and culture

• Practice your response, but remain flexible and authentic

• Use this question as an opportunity to demonstrate your value

With careful preparation and a positive attitude, you can confidently navigate this common interview question and move one step closer to landing your ideal job. Your answer should leave the interviewer with a clear understanding of your motivations and excitement about the potential to contribute to their organization. By following the guidance provided in this comprehensive guide, you’ll be well-equipped to make a lasting impression and stand out as a top candidate in your job search journey.

item.title: simple life quotes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Simple Life Quotes: 40 Reminders That Happiness Lies in Simplicity

Simple Life Quotes: 40 Reminders That Happiness Lies in Simplicity

In a world full of noise and chaos, simple life quotes offer a breath of fresh air.

These wise words remind us to slow down and enjoy the little things. They show us that happiness doesn't come from having more but from appreciating what we already have.

A simple life means focusing on what truly matters. It's about cutting out the clutter and stress that hold us back. Simple life quotes teach us to live with less but to feel more. They encourage us to find joy in everyday moments and to value experiences over things.

In this article, we'll explore some powerful, simple life quotes that can change how you see the world. We gathered these quotes from various sources, Thursday (15/8/2024). These powerful words will inspire you to simplify your life and find more peace and happiness.

A. Short Simple Life Quotes

1. "Live as if you were to die tomorrow" - Mahatma Gandhi

2. "Live a simple life; you will own the most beautiful treasures of the world!" - Mehmet Murat Ildan

3. "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." - Leonardo da Vinci

4. "Let me tell you something: I'm a simple person who lives a simple life." - Bill Cowher

5. "Simplicity is the glory of expression." - Walt Whitman

6. "Live simply so that others may simply live." - Mahatma Gandhi

7. "Simple life and peaceful mind are very close friends!" - Mehmet Murat Ildan

8. "Our life is frittered away by detail... simplify, simplify." - Henry David Thoreau

9. "Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated." - Confucius

10. "Manifest plainness, embrace simplicity, reduce selfishness, have few desires." - Laozi

10. "Manifest plainness, embrace simplicity, reduce selfishness, have few desires." - Laozi

11. "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." - George Bernard Shaw

12. "A simple life gives birth to more clarity, inner peace and meaningful relationships." - Margo Vader

13. "Stay low, stay quiet, keep it simple, don't expect too much, enjoy what you have." - Dean Koontz

14. "The first step in crafting the life you want is to get rid of everything you don't." - Joshua Becker

15. "Make everything as simple as possible, but not simpler." - Albert Einstein

B. Simple Life Quotes About Happiness

1. "Happiness is not having what you want. It is wanting what you have." - Rabbi Hyman Schachtel

2. "The richest of all people is a little child who is so happy with few simple toys! – Mehmet Murat Ildan

3. "To be richer, happier, and freer, all you need to do is want less." - Francine Jay

4. "The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less." - Socrates

5. Be a curator of your life. Slowly cut things out until you're left only with what you love, with what's necessary, with what makes you happy." - Leo Babauta

6. "Happiness cannot be traveled to owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude." – Denis Waitley

7. "It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness." - Charles Haddon Spurgeon

8. "Minimalism is a tool to eliminate life's excess, focus on the essentials, and find happiness, fulfillment, and freedom." - Joshua Fields Millburn and Ryan Nicodemus

9. "A very disappointing outcome is always destined to happen to anyone who chases material things in search of happiness." - Edmond Mbiaka

"If one's life is simple, contentment has to come. Simplicity is extremely important for happiness. Having few desires, feeling satisfied with what you have, is very vital: satisfaction with just enough food, clothing, and shelter to protect yourself from the elements."

- Dalai Lama

C. Simple Life Quotes for Peaceful Life

1. "Life is as simple as these three questions: What do I want? Why do I want it? And, how will I achieve it?" - Shannon L. Alder

2. "Be simple and live simple, thus you rise incorruptible." - Abhijit Naskar

3. "The question of what you want to own is actually the question of how you want to live your life." - Marie Kondo

4. "Minimalism is the intentional promotion of the things we most value and the removal of everything that distracts us from it." - Joshua Becker

5. "We buy things we don't need with money we don't have to impress people we don't like." - Dave Ramsey

6. "A home with fewer possessions is more spacious, more calming, and more focused on the people who live inside it." - Joshua Becker

7. "Think how joyous each and every day could be when you are making the most of what you have." - Chrissy Halton

8. "When we lead a simple life, we achieve an unknown happiness —a happiness that surpasses any other form of happiness." - Avijeet Das

9. "The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of non-essentials." - Lin Yutang

10. "As you simplify your life, the laws of the universe will be simpler; solitude will not be solitude, poverty will not be poverty, nor weakness weakness." - Henry David Thoreau

11. "While you are alive collect moments, not things, earn respect, not money, and enjoy love, not luxuries." - Aarti Khurana

12. "Simplicity boils down to two things: identify the essential and eliminate the rest." - Leo Babauta

13. "Going back to a simpler life is not a step backward." - Yvon Chouinard

14. "Life is better when we don't try to do everything. Learn to enjoy the slice of life you experience, and life turns out to be wonderful." - Leo Babauta

15. "Simplicity is making the journey of this life with just baggage enough." - Charles Dudley Warner

item.title: emoji
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
10-Year-Old Petitions Apple to Change Emoji for Being Mocked

10-Year-Old Petitions Apple to Change Emoji for Being Mocked

A 10-year-old boy from the city of Oxfordshire, UK, created a petition suing Apple to replace the 'nerd face' emoji with one with glasses and two 'rabbit' teeth.

The child named Teddy thinks that the 'nerd face' emoji makes people with glasses feel ugly and is often bullied. Teddy wants this emoji to be replaced with a design that he drew.

"We want to change this. Apple makes people with glasses ugly. This makes me sad, and if I feel offended then so do thousands of people in the world," Teddy said in an interview with the BBC.

Teddy showed an image made to replace the 'nerd emoji, the image he called the 'genius emoji' which draws the face of a typical genius figure with glasses.

Teddy's 'Genius emoji' shows glasses designed with thinner frames that look more handsome and a smile without 'rabbit teeth'.

"It has thinner lenses and frames and a small smile without bunny teeth. I like wearing glasses because they help me see better, look good and are stylish," he said.

Emojis are icons or symbols popular in social media or messaging applications like WhatsApp. Last year, WhatsApp finally released a text reaction feature in the form of emojis like those on Facebook.

Although they have the same standard meaning, the emoji form on the Android, iOS, or iPhone operating systems differs. Some emojis are not even found on either operating system.

item.title: how to know if chicken is bad
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
How to Tell if Chicken is Bad: 5 Simple Tests You Can Do

Do you want to know how to tell if chicken is bad before cooking it for your family? Chicken is one of the most popular meats worldwide, but it can also be dangerous if not handled properly. Eating spoiled chicken can cause serious food poisoning and make you very sick.

Every year, millions of people get sick from eating contaminated chicken. Learning how to tell if chicken is bad can protect your family from foodborne illness. Fresh chicken should look, smell, and feel a certain way, and knowing these signs helps you make safe choices in the kitchen.

In this article, we will share some ways to tell if chicken is bad. We will also talk about how to store and thaw chicken properly and how long does it last in your fridge. We gathered the information from various sources, Thursday (12/6/2025).

How to Tell if Chicken is Bad

The signs of spoiled chicken are easy to spot when you know what to look for. There are several ways to check if your chicken has gone bad using your senses and basic food safety knowledge.

Check the Color

Fresh raw chicken should have a light pink color with white fat pieces. When chicken starts to spoil, the color changes to gray or yellow-green. If you see any gray areas or strange colors on the meat, throw it away immediately. Cooked chicken should be white throughout with no pink areas. If cooked chicken turns gray or develops dark spots, it has gone bad and should not be eaten.

Smell Test

Bad chicken has a strong, unpleasant smell that you cannot miss. Fresh chicken has very little smell, but spoiled chicken smells sour, like ammonia, or similar to rotten eggs. If the chicken has any strange or bad smell, do not cook or eat it. Trust your nose - if something smells wrong, it probably is wrong.

Feel the Texture

Fresh chicken feels smooth and slightly moist but not slimy. When chicken goes bad, it becomes very slimy or sticky to touch. If the chicken feels slippery even after rinsing it with water, throw it away. Raw chicken should be firm but not hard, and cooked chicken should feel dry and firm.

Check the Sell-By Date

Always look at the date on the package before buying or using chicken. If the sell-by date has passed, the chicken might not be safe to eat. Use raw chicken within 1-2 days of the sell-by date, or freeze it for later use. Remember that the date is just a guide - you still need to check the color, smell, and texture.

Look for Mold

Any sign of mold on chicken means it has gone very bad. Mold can appear as green, black, or white fuzzy spots on the meat. If you see any mold, throw away the entire piece of chicken immediately. Never try to cut off moldy parts and use the rest - this is not safe.

How Long Does Chicken Last?

Different types of chicken stay fresh for different amounts of time depending on how you store them. This information helps you plan meals and avoid food waste.

Raw Chicken Storage Times

Raw chicken pieces last 1-2 days in the refrigerator when stored properly. Whole raw chickens can stay fresh for the same amount of time. Ground chicken spoils faster and should be used within 1-2 days. If you cannot use raw chicken within this time, freeze it to keep it safe for longer.

Cooked Chicken Storage Times

Cooked chicken lasts longer than raw chicken in the refrigerator. You can safely eat cooked chicken for 3-4 days after cooking if you store it properly. Chicken casseroles and dishes with sauce may last slightly longer because the sauce helps protect the meat. Always reheat cooked chicken to at least 165°F before eating leftovers.

Frozen Chicken Duration

Frozen chicken lasts much longer than fresh chicken. According to USDA guidelines, chicken remains safe to eat forever when kept frozen continuously, and package expiration dates become meaningless once frozen. For the best taste and texture, whole raw chickens should be used within one year, chicken parts within 9 months, and ground chicken within 3-4 months of freezing.

How to Store Chicken Correctly

If you want your chicken to last longer, you should know how to store it properly to prevent harmful bacteria from growing. These correct storage methods are one of the most important steps in food safety.

Refrigerator Storage

Keep raw chicken in the coldest part of your refrigerator, usually the bottom shelf. Store chicken in its original package or put it in a leak-proof container to prevent juices from dripping onto other foods. Keep your refrigerator temperature at 40°F or below to slow bacterial growth. Never leave chicken on the counter or in warm areas.

Freezer Storage

Wrap chicken tightly in freezer paper, aluminum foil, or plastic freezer bags before freezing. Remove as much air as possible from the packaging to prevent freezer burn. Label packages with the date so you know how long they have been frozen. Store chicken in the main part of the freezer, not in the door where temperatures change more often.

Preventing Cross-Contamination

Always keep raw chicken separate from other foods in your refrigerator and freezer. Use different cutting boards for raw chicken and other foods, or wash cutting boards thoroughly between uses. Wash your hands with soap and warm water for at least 20 seconds after handling raw chicken. Clean all surfaces and utensils that touch raw chicken with hot, soapy water.

How to Thaw Chicken Safely

When you take out frozen chicken before cooking, you should thaw the chicken safely to prevent dangerous bacteria from growing and multiplying. Safe thawing methods keep your food at proper temperatures throughout the process.

Refrigerator Thawing

The safest way to thaw chicken is in the refrigerator. This method takes longer but keeps chicken at a safe temperature throughout the thawing process. Small chicken pieces need about 24 hours to thaw completely. Large whole chickens may need 1-2 days depending on their size. Plan ahead when using this method.

Cold Water Thawing

For faster thawing, put chicken in a leak-proof plastic bag and submerge it in cold water. Change the water every 30 minutes to keep it cold. Small chicken pieces thaw in about 1 hour using this method. Never use warm or hot water because this allows bacteria to grow in the outer layers of the meat.

Microwave Thawing

You can thaw chicken in the microwave if you plan to cook it immediately afterward. Use the defrost setting on your microwave and follow the manufacturer's instructions. Cook the chicken right away after microwave thawing because some parts may start cooking during the thawing process.

Unsafe Thawing Methods

Never thaw chicken on the kitchen counter, in hot water, or in other warm places. These methods allow the outside of the chicken to reach dangerous temperatures while the inside stays frozen. This creates perfect conditions for harmful bacteria to multiply quickly and can make you very sick.

item.title: Questions to Ask a Girl
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Great Questions to Ask a Girl: 330+ Fun and Meaningful Conversation Starters

Talking to girls can sometimes feel hard. But asking good questions is a great way to start fun conversations and get to know someone better. This article has over 330 questions you can ask a girl – from fun and silly to deep and serious. Use these to talk to a girl you like, make new friends, or have better chats with your girlfriend.

Fun Questions to Ask a Girl

These fun questions are great for starting light conversations:

• What’s your favorite season?

• Are you a dog person or a cat person?

• If you could be any animal, what would you be?

• What’s your favorite joke?

• What’s the funniest thing that happened to you recently?

• If you won a million dollars, what’s the first thing you’d buy?

• What’s your go-to karaoke song?

• If you could have any superpower, what would it be?

• What’s the weirdest food you’ve ever tried?

• If you could be a character in any TV show, who would you be?

Questions to Get to Know Her Better

These questions help you learn more about her personality and life:

• What’s your favorite way to relax after a long day?

• What’s something you’re really proud of?

• Who has been the biggest influence in your life?

• What’s your dream job?

• Where’s your favorite place you’ve ever traveled?

• What’s the best advice anyone has ever given you?

• What are you most passionate about?

• What’s your favorite childhood memory?

• If you could learn any skill instantly, what would it be?

• What’s something not many people know about you?

Deep Questions to Ask a Girl

For more meaningful conversations, try these deeper questions:

• What do you think is the meaning of life?

• What’s your biggest fear?

• If you could change one thing about the world, what would it be?

• What do you think happens after we die?

• What’s the hardest lesson you’ve had to learn?

• What do you think makes a life well-lived?

• How do you define success?

• What’s something you believe that most people don’t?

• What’s the biggest mistake you’ve made and how did you learn from it?

• If you could give advice to your younger self, what would you say?

Questions About Her Childhood and Family

Learn about her background with these questions:

• What was your favorite thing to do as a kid?

• Who were you closest to in your family growing up?

• What’s a funny story your family likes to tell about you?

• Did you have any childhood pets?

• What’s your favorite family tradition?

• Who was your biggest role model when you were young?

• What’s the best piece of advice your parents gave you?

• What was your favorite subject in school?

• Did you have any nicknames as a kid?

• What’s your favorite memory from a family vacation?

Questions About Her Interests and Hobbies

Find out what she likes to do for fun:

• What do you like to do in your free time?

• Do you play any sports or instruments?

• What’s your favorite book?

• What kind of music do you like best?

• Do you have any collections?

• What’s a skill you’d like to learn?

• Do you like to cook? What’s your favorite thing to make?

• What websites or apps do you use the most?

• Are you into any TV shows right now?

• If you could pick up any new hobby, what would it be?

Questions About Her Dreams and Goals

Learn about her hopes for the future:

• What’s your biggest dream in life?

• Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

• If you could have any job in the world, what would it be?

• What’s something you’ve always wanted to try but haven’t yet?

• If you could live anywhere, where would it be?

• What’s on your bucket list?

• How do you want to make the world a better place?

• What do you hope to accomplish in the next year?

• If you wrote a book, what would it be about?

• What’s a cause you really care about?

Funny and Random Questions

Make her laugh with these silly questions:

• If you were a sandwich, what kind would you be?

• What’s the worst fashion trend you’ve ever followed?

• If you could eat only one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?

• What’s the weirdest dream you’ve ever had?

• If you were famous, what would you want to be famous for?

• What’s the strangest talent you have?

• If you could have dinner with any three people, dead or alive, who would you choose?

• What’s the most embarrassing song on your playlist?

• If you were a character in a horror movie, how long would you survive?

• What’s the silliest argument you’ve ever had?

Questions About Love and Relationships

For romantic conversations, try these questions:

• What’s your idea of a perfect date?

• Do you believe in love at first sight?

• What’s the most romantic thing someone’s ever done for you?

• What’s your love language?

• What do you think makes a relationship strong?

• What’s a deal-breaker for you in a relationship?

• Do you believe in soulmates?

• What’s the best relationship advice you’ve ever gotten?

• What’s your favorite way to show affection?

• How do you like to be comforted when you’re upset?

Questions to Ask Over Text

These work well for texting conversations:

• What’s the last song you listened to?

• What are you looking forward to this week?

• Have you watched any good movies lately?

• What’s the best thing that happened to you today?

• If you could be anywhere right now, where would you be?

• What’s your favorite emoji?

• What’s the last thing that made you laugh out loud?

• If you could have any animal as a pet, what would you choose?

• What’s your favorite way to spend a lazy day?

• If you could instantly become an expert in something, what would it be?

Would You Rather Questions

These fun questions make her choose between two options:

• Would you rather be able to fly or be invisible?

• Would you rather live in the city or the countryside?

• Would you rather travel to the past or the future?

• Would you rather have a personal chef or a personal trainer?

• Would you rather always be 10 minutes late or 20 minutes early?

• Would you rather be able to read minds or see the future?

• Would you rather have unlimited money or unlimited time?

• Would you rather never have to sleep or never have to eat?

• Would you rather be famous for your looks or your talent?

• Would you rather live without music or without TV?

This or That Questions

Ask her to pick between these choices:

• Coffee or tea?

• Beach or mountains?

• Books or movies?

• Cats or dogs?

• Summer or winter?

• Chocolate or vanilla?

• Texting or calling?

• Early bird or night owl?

• Introvert or extrovert?

• Plan everything or go with the flow?

Questions About Her Opinions

Get to know her views on different topics:

• What do you think is the biggest problem in the world today?

• How do you feel about social media?

• What’s your opinion on climate change?

• Do you think aliens exist?

• What’s your view on marriage?

• How do you feel about tattoos?

• What’s your take on online dating?

• Do you believe in ghosts?

• What’s your stance on vegetarianism?

• How do you feel about technology in our daily lives?

Questions About Her Past

Learn about her history with these questions:

• What’s the craziest thing you’ve ever done?

• What was your first job?

• Who was your first crush?

• What’s the best trip you’ve ever taken?

• What’s a moment in your life you’ll never forget?

• What’s the biggest risk you’ve ever taken?

• What’s your biggest regret?

• What’s the hardest thing you’ve ever had to do?

• What’s your proudest accomplishment?

• What’s the best gift you’ve ever received?

Questions About Her Personality

Understand her character better with these questions:

• How would your friends describe you?

• What three words best describe your personality?

• What’s your biggest strength?

• What’s your biggest weakness?

• Are you more of a planner or spontaneous person?

• How do you handle stress?

• What makes you feel most confident?

• How do you like to celebrate your achievements?

• What’s your approach to solving problems?

• How do you recharge after a long day?

Questions About Her Values

Learn what’s important to her:

• What’s the most important thing in your life?

• What qualities do you value most in a friend?

• What do you think is the key to happiness?

• How important is family to you?

• What role does religion or spirituality play in your life?

• What do you think is the most important quality in a romantic partner?

• How do you define success?

• What’s a cause you’re passionate about?

• What do you think is the most important life lesson everyone should learn?

• What legacy do you want to leave behind?

Questions for a First Date

These work well when you’re just getting to know each other:

• What do you like to do for fun on weekends?

• What kind of music do you enjoy?

• Do you have any siblings?

• What’s your favorite place you’ve ever traveled?

• What do you do for work? Do you enjoy it?

• Are you a morning person or a night owl?

• What’s your favorite type of food?

• Do you have any pets?

• What’s the last good book you read?

• What’s something you’re looking forward to in the near future?

Questions for Long-Term Couples

Keep the spark alive with these questions for established relationships:

• What’s your favorite memory of us together?

• What’s something new you’d like us to try together?

• How can I be a better partner to you?

• What’s your idea of a perfect day together?

• What’s something I do that always makes you smile?

• How do you think we’ve grown as a couple?

• What’s a goal you’d like us to work towards together?

• What’s your favorite thing about our relationship?

• Is there anything you’d like to change about our relationship?

• What do you think has been the key to our relationship’s success?

Conclusion

Asking good questions is a great way to start interesting conversations and get to know someone better. Whether you’re talking to a new friend, a girl you like, or your long-term girlfriend, these questions can help you connect on a deeper level. Remember, the best conversations flow naturally, so use these questions as starting points and let the talk develop from there. Most importantly, listen carefully to her answers and show genuine interest in what she has to say. Good communication is key to building strong relationships.

item.title: shark
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Guys in India Beat Giant Shark to Death for Revenge

Guys in India Beat Giant Shark to Death for Revenge

A giant shark was beaten to death after biting the leg of a man who was fishing in a river.

The incident, which occurred in Palghar District, India, on Wednesday (14/2), began when the leg of a man identified as Vickey Govari was bitten by a shark. At that time, he was fishing in a river with his friends. Responding to Govari's screams, his friends immediately pulled him away from the shark.

However, their efforts to save themselves did not end there. They then beat the shark to death.

Despite surviving, Govari suffered a bad condition in his calf muscle, so after that, he was immediately rushed to the hospital and received emergency treatment.

Pawan Sharma, founder and president of the non-profit organization RAWW (Resqink Association for Wildlife Welfare), said the shark involved in this incident was about seven feet long and weighed nearly 130 kg.

Shark attacks in rivers are unusual as these fish usually live in saltwater, such as the sea. However, bull sharks can live and breed in freshwater and are known to swim in narrow waterways.

Sharma mentioned that there are also reports and evidence of them being found in rivers and dams located several kilometers from saltwater for reasons such as lack of prey due to overfishing.

item.title: BLACKPINK Jisoo
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
BLACKPINK's Jisoo Reportedly Sign With Her Brother's Company

BLACKPINK’s Jisoo will reportedly join her brother’s company for solo activities.

BLACKPINK's Jisoo Reportedly Sign With Her Brother's Company

BLACKPINK's Jisoo will reportedly start her solo career with her brother's company, Biomom.

According to Xportnews, Jisoo will collaborate with her older brother, Kim Jung Hun, owner of Biomom, a health food brand.

Biomom has recently attracted attention for its expansion into the entertainment industry.

The company is planning a new business.

The entertainment division is temporarily named Blissoo. That sparked speculation about Jisoo's relationship with the company.

However, Biomom representatives admitted that they were not aware of this development.

They stated that it was difficult to clarify the relationship between the company and Blissoo.

Despite separating for solo activities, all BLACKPINK members, including Jisoo, will continue to be with YG Entertainment for group activities.

item.title: banana
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Swedish Minister Has Banana Phobia, Bans Fruit on Official Visits

Sweden's Minister of Gender Equality, Paulina Brandberg, has made headlines for her phobia. She has an unusual phobia of bananas.

Her fear of this fruit led to a special request for a “banana-free” environment during her official visit.

The Phobia

Brandberg suffers from bananaphobia. His intense fear of bananas can trigger anxiety and nausea when she sees or smells the fruit. This phobia is not common but can have a significant impact on daily life.

In a post on X (formerly Twitter) in 2020, Brandberg described her condition as “the weirdest phobia in the world. However, the post has since been deleted.

Official Requests

According to Sky News, leaked emails revealed that Brandberg's staff always ensured the room was banana-free before her official events. The requests included explicit instructions to remove bananas from the venue.

An example of the request is an email sent before events, including VIP lunches. They specifically stated that “there should be no bananas” in the area where the minister would be.

Seeking Help

Brandberg recognizes her phobia and is currently seeking professional help to overcome it. She describes the effects of her condition as something similar to allergies.

item.title: Taylor Swift
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Is Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce Still Together? Here's What We Know!

Recently, there are rumors about Taylor Swift and NFL star Travis Kelce's break up according to Swift's social media hiatus and their recent rarely seen together in media.

However, is that even true?

In a recent appearance on his podcast with his brother Jason Kelce, the Chiefs tight end said something that sparked rumours between him and Swift.

During the May 14 episode of the New Heights podcast, the Kelce brothers sat down with fellow NFL icons Andrew Whitworth and Ryan Fitzpatrick.

In the middle of their discussion on Christmas traditions and schedule, Travis Kelce casually noted, “We’ve got our chimneys and furniture.”

Several fans have interpreted Kelce’s use of “we” as an accidental confirmation of him sharing a home with Taylor Swift.

Despite their highly publicized relationship, Kelce and Swift have managed to keep their private lives under wraps.

The couple, who began dating in late 2023, have been spending quality time together in Florida.

Kelce is currently renting a $20 million mansion in Boca Raton for his offseason training, and fans have speculated that Swift is staying with him.

In a recent episode of his "New Heights" podcast, Kelce referred to the property using "we," leading many to believe they are cohabitating.

Their low-profile lifestyle includes shared workouts, home-cooked meals, and cozy evenings.

An insider noted that the couple enjoys "slow mornings," with Swift preparing breakfast and the two spending time reading and relaxing together.

While Swift had been notably absent from social media, she recently broke her silence by liking a graduation video posted by Natalia Bryant, daughter of the late Kobe Bryant.

This interaction helped quell concerns among fans about potential issues in her relationship with Kelce.

Public appearances have been rare, but the couple was spotted together in Philadelphia celebrating Mother's Day with Kelce's family.

item.title: RPG-7
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Gun Review YouTuber Suffers Serious Head Injury While Testing an RPG-7

Gun Review YouTuber Suffers Serious Head Injury While Testing an RPG-7

A YouTuber from the United States (US) named Adam Knowles suffered severe brain injuries during a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) test firing.

The unfortunate incident happened in November when he recorded a video for the Ballistics High-Speed YouTube channel.

Quoted from the Hindustan Times, Adam recalled the incident and showed footage on the YouTube channel on Sunday (17/12).

At that time, Knowles, who is a retired soldier, put an RPG-7 on his shoulder to show what would happen to the head of the ballistic doll behind him.


However, the plan failed because the RPG-7 exploded when fired and injured Knowles.

Based on the findings, Knowles and his friend revealed that the launcher exploded when its booster detached and pressure escaped from a weak weld point.

The gruesome footage showed Knowles engulfed in flames as he fired the grenade from the RPG-7.

Recalling what happened, he revealed that part of the launcher exploded, and he was instantly knocked unconscious.

Not only that, the protective helmet and goggles he was wearing also flew off due to the violent shock.

Afterward, in the video footage, his friends can be seen rushing to his aid as he lies injured amidst the smoke.

By then, blood was oozing from a wound on his cheek, and his arm was scorched from the RPG explosion.

Someone can be heard shouting "Call 911!" for Knowles to get immediate treatment.

Knowles was rushed to a nearby hospital and was saved from the incident.

While watching footage of the incident, Knowles appeared to still be wearing a bandage on his arm and was shocked and exclaimed, "Oh my God!".


According to NewYorkPost, the accident left Knowles with a fractured skull, bleeding on the brain, a broken jaw, and burns over at least 10 percent of her body.

In addition, Knowles also suffered facial and chest injuries, as well as multiple shrapnel embedded in his body and long-term nerve damage.

Knowles has undergone several surgeries and received skin grafts for his burns, so he is expected to have to pay medical bills of $300,000.

Knowles says she feels much better but still has a long way to go to fully recover.

item.title: The Philippines
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
7 Philippines Souvenirs That You Must Take Back Home After a Vacation Here

7 Philippines Souvenirs That You Must Take Back Home After a Vacation Here

The Philippines with its breathtaking beaches, rich culture, and warm hospitality. The Philippines is a paradise for travelers seeking unforgettable experiences.

One delightful aspect of any trip is bringing back souvenirs that capture the essence of your journey. In the Philippines, you'll find many beautiful souvenirs. Each souvenir reflects the country's rich heritage and diverse traditions. Here are seven popular Philippines souvenirs you must take home after your vacation.

Photo: flickr/ricky sy

1. Filipino Pearls

The Philippines is famous for its beautiful pearls. Filipino pearls are often considered some of the best in the world.

Are you choosing shiny South Sea pearls or the more budget-friendly freshwater pearls? These gems make for timeless and elegant souvenirs.

You can find pearl jewelry in various forms, including necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and rings. Filipino pearls are perfect for adding a touch of Filipino elegance to your wardrobe.

Popular Philippines Souvenirs

2. Toy Jeepney

The iconic Jeepney is not just a mode of transportation; it's a symbol of Filipino culture and creativity. Miniature toy jeepneys are charming souvenirs.

Photo: flickr/Chris Flordeliza

This is also a way to carry a piece of Philippine history home with you. These colorful and intricately designed miniatures are often handcrafted and come in various sizes. Toy Jeepneys make them a delightful addition to your collection. It is also a great gift for friends and family.

Photo: flickr/Chris Flordeliza

Ube is a purple yam. It is a staple in Filipino desserts. Ube halaya is a sweet and creamy jam.

3. Ube Halaya and Jam

Ube halaya is a delightful treat that captures the essence of Filipino cuisine. Do you buy it in a jar or as a ready-to-eat snack? Taking home ube halaya is a tasty way to enjoy the flavors of the Philippines long after your vacation ends.

Photo: firefly.adobe

The salakot is a traditional Filipino hat. It is made of native materials such as bamboo and palm leaves.

4. Salakot

This iconic headpiece showcases the country's rich cultural heritage. The salakot is often intricately decorated. A salakot can be a unique decorative piece or a functional sun hat. This provides both style and shade.

Photo: flickr/Leo Cloma

The Philippines has a rich tradition of handwoven textiles. Each textile has its own unique patterns and stories.

5. Textiles and Fabrics

Fabrics like Hablon, Abaca, and Inabel are woven with great care and skill by local artisans. These textiles can be transformed into beautiful clothing, accessories, and home décor items. You can bring back a piece of Filipino craftsmanship. Choose the form of handwoven bags, scarves, or even a handcrafted Inabel blanket.
Photo: flickr/smark31

Sungka is a traditional Filipino board game. Sungka has been played for generations. It's a game of strategy and counting.

6. Sungka

Sungkas are a delightful way to spend time with family and friends. Compact and portable sungka sets are perfect for bringing a piece of Filipino culture into your home. Sungka is an enjoyable game. It also serves as a reminder of the warm Filipino hospitality you experienced during your trip.

Photo: flickr/dbgg1979

Philippine dried mangoes are not just any dried fruit. Dried mangoes are a delicious tropical delight. These are known for their sweet and tangy flavor.

7. Dried Mango

These snacks are a popular souvenir choice. You can find dried mangoes in various packaging sizes.

This makes it easy to share the taste of the Philippines with loved ones back home.

Photo: firefly.adobe

Popular Philippines Souvenirs That You Must Take Back Home After a Vacation Here

Bringing home souvenirs from the Philippines is a way to remember your vacation. It's also a way to share this remarkable country's beauty, culture, and flavors. These souvenirs are more than just items; they are cherished memories of your journey through the Philippines. So, make space in your suitcase when planning your next adventure to this breathtaking archipelago. Remember to bring these must-have Philippine souvenirs.

item.title: Employment status surveys
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Employment Status Survey Questions: A Comprehensive Guide

Employment status surveys are important tools for understanding people’s work situations. These surveys ask questions about jobs, work hours, and career paths. They help researchers, companies, and governments learn about the job market and workforce trends.

This guide will explain different types of employment status questions. It will show how to ask good questions and use the information you get. Whether you’re doing research, planning business strategies, or making policies, this guide will help you create better employment surveys.

Why Employment Status Questions Matter

Employment status questions are very useful. Here’s why they’re important:

• They show how the job market is doing

• They help make better economic policies

• Companies use them to understand their workers better

• They help match job seekers with the right jobs

• Researchers use them to study work trends

• They show if certain groups have trouble finding jobs

• They help plan education and job training programs

Good employment status questions give a clear picture of how people work. This information helps make better decisions about the economy, business, and social programs.

Basic Employment Status Questions

Here are some simple questions to ask about employment status:

• Are you currently employed?

• Yes, full-time

• Yes, part-time

• No, not employed

• How many hours do you work per week?

• Less than 20 hours

• 20-34 hours

• 35-40 hours

• More than 40 hours

• What best describes your current work situation?

• Employed by a company

• Self-employed

• Unemployed and looking for work

• Not working and not looking for work

• Retired

• Student

These basic questions give a quick overview of someone’s job status. They’re easy to answer and provide important information about employment levels and types of work.

Detailed Employment Status Questions

For a deeper understanding of employment, you can ask more detailed questions:

• What type of employment contract do you have?

• Permanent

• Fixed-term

• Temporary

• Zero-hour contract

• Freelance/Contract work

• How long have you been in your current job?

• Less than 6 months

• 6 months to 1 year

• 1-3 years

• 3-5 years

• More than 5 years

• Do you have more than one job?

• No, just one job

• Yes, two jobs

• Yes, three or more jobs

• Are you actively looking for a new job?

• Yes, actively looking

• Casually looking

• No, not looking

These questions help understand job stability, multiple job holdings, and job-seeking behavior. They give a more complete picture of someone’s work life.

Industry-Specific Employment Questions

Different industries have unique employment patterns. Here are questions to understand industry-specific work:

• Which industry do you work in?

• Healthcare

• Education

• Technology

• Retail

• Manufacturing

• Finance

• Other (please specify)

• Is your job seasonal?

• Yes, it’s seasonal work

• No, it’s year-round

• Does your job require specific certifications or licenses?

• Yes (please specify)

• No

• How often do you need to update your skills for your job?

• Constantly

• Every few years

• Rarely

• Never

These questions help understand the unique aspects of different industries. They show how jobs change across sectors and what skills are needed.

Income-Related Employment Questions

Income is an important part of employment. Here are some questions about work and money:

• What is your annual income range?

• Less than $20,000

• $20,000 – $40,000

• $40,001 – $60,000

• $60,001 – $80,000

• $80,001 – $100,000

• More than $100,000

• Prefer not to say

• How are you paid?

• Hourly wage

• Annual salary

• Commission

• Project-based

• Other (please specify)

• Does your job offer benefits? (Select all that apply)

• Health insurance

• Retirement plan

• Paid time off

• Stock options

• No benefits

• Has your income changed in the last year?

• Increased

• Stayed the same

• Decreased

These questions help understand how jobs pay and what benefits they offer. This information is useful for studying living standards and job quality.

Education and Work Experience Questions

Education and work experience are closely linked to employment. Here are questions about this:

• What is your highest level of education?

• High school or less

• Some college

• Bachelor’s degree

• Master’s degree

• Doctoral degree

• Professional degree (MD, JD, etc.)

• How many years of work experience do you have?

• Less than 1 year

• 1-3 years

• 4-7 years

• 8-15 years

• More than 15 years

• Is your current job related to your field of study?

• Yes, directly related

• Somewhat related

• Not related at all

• Have you received job-specific training in the last year?

• Yes

• No

These questions show how education and experience affect employment. They help understand skills gaps and training needs in the workforce.

Job Satisfaction and Career Goals Questions

Understanding how people feel about their jobs is important. Here are questions about job satisfaction and career goals:

• How satisfied are you with your current job?

• Very satisfied

• Somewhat satisfied

• Neutral

• Somewhat dissatisfied

• Very dissatisfied

• Do you feel your job uses your skills and abilities?

• Yes, fully

• Somewhat

• No, not at all

• Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

• In the same job

• In a higher position at the same company

• Working for a different company

• In a different career

• Not sure

• What is most important to you in a job? (Choose top 3)

• Salary

• Work-life balance

• Career growth

• Job security

• Meaningful work

• Good coworkers

• Benefits

These questions help understand job satisfaction and career aspirations. This information is useful for employers to improve worker happiness and keep good employees.

Remote Work and Flexibility Questions

Remote work and job flexibility are becoming more common. Here are questions about this:

• Do you work remotely?

• Yes, full-time remote

• Yes, part-time remote

• No, I work on-site

• How often do you work from home?

• Every day

• A few days a week

• Once a week

• Occasionally

• Never

• Does your job offer flexible hours?

• Yes, very flexible

• Somewhat flexible

• No, set hours only

• How has remote work affected your productivity?

• Increased a lot

• Increased a little

• No change

• Decreased a little

• Decreased a lot

These questions help understand new work trends. They show how jobs are changing and how this affects workers and companies.

Unemployment and Job Search Questions

For people without jobs, it’s important to understand their situation. Here are questions for unemployed people:

• How long have you been unemployed?

• Less than 1 month

• 1-3 months

• 4-6 months

• 7-12 months

• More than 1 year

• What is the main reason you’re not working?

• Lost job due to company downsizing

• Quit previous job

• Can’t find work in my field

• Taking care of family

• Health reasons

• Studying

• Other (please specify)

• Are you actively looking for a job?

• Yes, very actively

• Yes, casually

• No, not looking right now

• What challenges are you facing in finding a job? (Select all that apply)

• Lack of jobs in my field

• Not enough experience

• Need more education or training

• Age discrimination

• Location issues

• Other (please specify)

These questions help understand unemployment issues. They show why people are out of work and what problems they face finding jobs.

Self-Employment and Entrepreneurship Questions

Self-employed people and entrepreneurs have unique work situations. Here are questions for them:

• Are you self-employed or an entrepreneur?

• Yes, full-time

• Yes, part-time

• No

• How long have you been self-employed?

• Less than 1 year

• 1-3 years

• 4-7 years

• 8-15 years

• More than 15 years

• What type of business do you run?

• Sole proprietorship

• Partnership

• Limited Liability Company (LLC)

• Corporation

• Freelance/Independent Contractor

• What are the biggest challenges in running your own business? (Select top 3)

• Finding clients/customers

• Managing finances

• Time management

• Dealing with regulations

• Hiring and managing employees

• Competing with larger businesses

• Work-life balance

These questions help understand the self-employed workforce. They show the challenges and experiences of people who work for themselves.

Retirement and Post-Career Questions

For older workers and retirees, it’s important to understand their work situation. Here are questions about retirement and late-career work:

• Are you retired?

• Yes, fully retired

• Semi-retired (still working part-time)

• No, still working full-time

• Planning to retire soon

• If retired, do you work in any capacity?

• Yes, part-time job

• Yes, occasional freelance work

• Yes, volunteer work

• No, not working at all

• At what age did you retire (or plan to retire)?

• Before 60

• 60-65

• 66-70

• After 70

• Not sure

• What factors influenced (or will influence) your decision to retire? (Select all that apply)

• Financial readiness

• Health reasons

• Desire for leisure time

• Care for family members

• Mandatory retirement age

• Job dissatisfaction

• Other (please specify)

These questions help understand retirement trends. They show how people transition out of work and what retirement looks like for different people.

Employment Status in Demographic Context

Employment status is often linked to other personal factors. Here are questions that put employment in a broader context:

• What is your age group?

• 18-24

• 25-34

• 35-44

• 45-54

• 55-64

• 65 or older

• What is your gender?

• Male

• Female

• Non-binary

• Prefer not to say

• What is your marital status?

• Single

• Married

• Divorced

• Widowed

• In a domestic partnership

• Do you have children under 18 living at home?

• Yes

• No

• In which region do you live?

• [List relevant regions or areas]

These questions help understand how personal factors relate to employment. They show patterns in work across different groups and life stages.

Best Practices for Employment Status Surveys

To get good information from employment status surveys, follow these tips:

• Keep questions clear and simple

• Use language that everyone can understand

• Give enough answer choices to cover all situations

• Include “Other” or “Prefer not to say” options

• Ask only what you need to know

• Test your survey with a small group first

• Make sure the survey works on computers and phones

• Keep the survey short – 10-15 minutes is good

• Explain why you’re asking these questions

• Tell people how you’ll use their answers

• Keep answers private and secure

Following these tips will help you get honest, useful answers. It will also make the survey easier for people to complete.

Analyzing Employment Status Survey Data

After you collect survey answers, you need to understand what they mean. Here’s how to analyze employment status data:

• Look for patterns in the answers

• Compare different groups (like age groups or job types)

• Use charts and graphs to show the results

• Check if the results match other studies or data

• Think about what the results mean for policy or business decisions

• Look for unexpected or surprising results

• Consider how recent events might affect the results

• Think about doing the survey again later to see changes over time

Good analysis helps turn survey answers into useful information. It can show important trends and help make better decisions about work and employment.

Ethical Considerations in Employment Surveys

When doing employment surveys, it’s important to be ethical. Here are some things to think about:

• Respect people’s privacy

• Don’t force anyone to answer

• Be clear about how you’ll use the information

• Keep personal information safe

• Don’t ask questions that could lead to discrimination

• Be honest about the survey’s purpose

• Share the results with participants if possible

• Follow laws about data protection

• Be careful with sensitive topics like income or health

• Treat all participants fairly and equally

Being ethical builds trust with survey participants. It also makes sure the survey is fair and the results are reliable.

Future Trends in Employment Status Surveys

Employment surveys are changing as work changes. Here are some future trends to watch:

• More questions about remote work and flexible jobs

• Focus on gig economy and freelance work

• Questions about technology skills and digital literacy

• Interest in work-life balance and job satisfaction

• Surveys that work well on smartphones

• Using AI to analyze survey results

• Combining survey data with other information sources

• More frequent, shorter surveys to track quick changes

• Questions about green jobs and sustainability

• Interest in lifelong learning and career changes

These trends show how employment surveys are adapting to new ways of working. They help us understand the changing world of work.

Conclusion

Employment status surveys are very important tools. They help us understand how people work and what challenges they face. Good surveys ask clear questions and respect people’s privacy. The information from these surveys can help make better policies, improve job training, and help businesses understand their workers.

As work keeps changing, employment surveys will change too. They’ll ask about new types of jobs, different ways of working, and what people want from their careers. By using these surveys well, we can learn a lot about the workforce and help create better work opportunities for everyone.

Remember, the goal of employment status surveys is to improve our understanding of work and help make work better for all people. Whether you’re creating a survey, taking one, or using the results, keep in mind how important this information is for shaping the future of work.

item.title: most beautiful towns in Colorado
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Top 7 Most Beautiful Towns in Colorado You Need to Visit

The most beautiful towns in Colorado offer amazing views of mountains, forests, and lakes. These small towns are nestled between tall peaks and green valleys, providing you with perfect spots to take photos and enjoy nature. Each town has its own special charm, from historic buildings to modern ski resorts.

Colorado's mountain towns are wonderful places to visit in every season. In winter, you can ski on snowy slopes, while summer invites you to hike through fields of colorful flowers. In fall, the trees turn gold and red, creating stunning views everywhere you look.

In this article, we will explore the most beautiful towns in Colorado. Get ready to discover your next travel destination!

1. Crested Butte

Crested Butte is famous for its vibrant wildflowers and breathtaking mountain views. This charming town is perfect for skiing in winter and hiking during summer. You can enjoy unique local shops, art galleries, and cozy restaurants. Its friendly atmosphere makes it an ideal place for families and anyone looking to relax amid stunning natural scenery.

2. Creede

Creede is a historic mining town surrounded by beautiful mountains and deep canyons. You can wander through its old buildings and explore fascinating museums. Outdoor activities include hiking, fishing, and attending local events. The town's small-town charm and stunning landscapes provide a perfect getaway for nature lovers and those seeking a peaceful experience.

3. Estes Park

Estes Park is known as the entrance to Rocky Mountain National Park. You can explore stunning landscapes, hike scenic trails, and watch for wildlife. The town features a charming downtown area filled with shops, cafes, and restaurants. Estes Park is an excellent destination for outdoor enthusiasts and those looking for a relaxing escape in nature.

4. Breckenridge

Breckenridge is a popular ski resort town celebrated for its historic Main Street. In winter, you can flock to its snowy slopes, while summer offers hiking and biking opportunities. The town is filled with delightful shops, art galleries, and restaurants. Throughout the year, Breckenridge hosts various events, making it a lively and enjoyable place to visit.

5. Glenwood Springs

Glenwood Springs is famous for its natural hot springs and stunning views of the surrounding mountains. You can relax in warm, soothing pools or enjoy outdoor activities like hiking and rafting. The town has a vibrant atmosphere, with many shops, eateries, and attractions. Glenwood Springs is an excellent destination for relaxation and exploration in Colorado.

6. Telluride

Telluride is a picturesque mountain town known for its breathtaking scenery and outdoor adventures. You can ski in winter or hike among stunning landscapes in summer. The historic downtown area features charming architecture, local boutiques, and inviting restaurants. With various festivals throughout the year, Telluride offers a vibrant atmosphere for travelers to enjoy.

7. Durango

Durango is a historic town renowned for its rich railroad history and scenic beauty. You can ride the Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad to experience breathtaking views. The lively downtown area features shops, art galleries, and diverse dining options. With beautiful parks and mountains nearby, Durango is the perfect base for outdoor activities and adventures.

item.title: most dangerous movie stunt
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
5 Most Dangerous Movie Stunts Done by Actors!

Here are 5 actors who performed their own dangerous movie stunt scenes

5 Most Dangerous Movie Stunts Done by Actors!

In making action films, dangerous scenes are usually done by stuntmen so that the actor does not get injured.

However, some actors decided to perform dangerous stunt scenes by themselves for certain reasons.

Here are 5 actors who performed their own dangerous movie stunt scenes

Tom Cruise is renowned for performing his own stunts, and the "Mission: Impossible" series showcases some of his most daring feats.

In "Mission: Impossible - Fallout," he executed a HALO (High Altitude Low Opening) jump, leaping from a plane at 25,000 feet with minimal oxygen, making it one of the most dangerous skydiving stunts in film history.

Tom Cruise - Mission Impossible Franshise

Jackie Chan is synonymous with jaw-dropping stunts, and in "Police Story," he performed a scene where he slides down a pole covered in light bulbs.

During filming, Chan misjudged the stunt, resulting in severe burns to his hands. Despite the injury, he continued filming to ensure the scene's authenticity.

Jackie Chan - Police Story (1985)

In his debut as James Bond, Daniel Craig performed a breathtaking stunt where his character engages in a high-stakes chase across a construction site.

During the sequence, Craig ran, jumped, and fought while navigating through various obstacles, culminating in a brutal confrontation atop a crane.

Daniel Craig - Casino Royale (2006)

"Cliffhanger" features numerous perilous stunts, including a scene where Sylvester Stallone dangles from a helicopter above a steep cliff.

Stallone, known for his dedication to realism, performed many of his stunts himself, adding an extra layer of danger to the film's intense action sequences.

Sylverster Stallone - Cliffhanger (1993)

In this iconic thriller set in the Appalachian wilderness, Burt Reynolds performed a dangerous canoeing stunt.

Reynolds navigated treacherous rapids, including the infamous "Suck Rock," which posed a significant risk to both actor and crew due to the unpredictable nature of the water.

Burt Reynolds - Deliverance (1972)

item.title: india
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Astrologer in India Predicts World War III Start Date

Astrologer in India Predicts World War III Start Date

The concept of a Third World War has been a topic of intense speculation and debate for decades.

With the devastating effects of the first two world wars still seared into global memory, the idea of another large-scale conflict is both frightening and intriguing.

Many astrologers, including Nostradamus and Baba Vanga, have predicted World War III, but its likelihood remains uncertain.

However, news about these predictions occasionally pops up on social media platforms and attracts considerable attention.

The latest in this series is a "prediction" made by Indian astrologer Kushal Kumar.

In a post on Medium, which he also shared on LinkedIn, Kumar claimed that World War 3 is just weeks away.

According to his LinkedIn profile, Kumar is a Vedic astrologer who uses charts showing planetary alignments to predict future events.

"The year 2024 is expected to be a very worrying year with respect to war conditions in hotspots around the world, especially around May 8 this year," he said.

"That date is indicated to experience the highest escalation in battlefields such as Korea, China-Taiwan, the Middle East involving Israel and other countries in the region, Ukraine-Russia, and then anger against NATO can also be expressed," he said.

The astrologer then revealed the dates he thinks a global war will happen.

He said in his article, "Tuesday, June 18, 2024 has the strongest planetary stimulus to trigger World War III, although June 10 and 29 may also be decisive."

Kumar, who lives in Panchkula, is an astrologer who predicts world events. Because of this, the news has gone viral on social media.

The claim comes just days after British officials launched a website telling Britons what they need to prepare for in case of war.

item.title: Trick to prevent flies from entering the house
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
Easy Trick to Prevent Flies from Entering the House

This simple method from an Instagram user has proven to be effective in preventing flies from entering the house.

Easy Trick to Prevent Flies from Entering the House

The presence of flies in the house, especially in the kitchen and dining area, can be very annoying.

Not only are flies known as dirty animals and carriers of bacteria, but they can also cause diseases.

An Instagram user @cutsyansyahnan shared some tips to prevent flies from entering the house without using chemicals.

Let's find out more information in the following summary.

Materials and Equipment

In his short video reel, @cutsyansyahnan only uses one material, which is aluminum foil. To achieve maximum results, he also adds water and uses a plastic bag.

1. Prepare Aluminum Foil Clumps

Prepare the available aluminum foil roll. Then, cut several sheets and fold them into round shapes resembling balls.

2. Prepare Water

Next, take a large enough plastic bag, about half a kilogram, and fill it with tap water.

3. Combine the Two Ingredients

Put the aluminum foil balls into a plastic bag that has been filled with water, then tie the plastic tightly to prevent any water from spilling.

4. Hang it on the House Ventilation

Hang the plastic bags filled with water and aluminum foil balls on the vents of your house, such as doors and windows. Hopefully, it will work!

Questions and Answers

Many people have questions about flies and their behavior. One common question is why flies are so attracted to garbage. The answer lies in their diet.

Flies are scavengers and feed on decaying organic matter. Garbage provides them with a plentiful food source, which is why they are often found in trash cans and landfills.

Another question is "why flies are so difficult to catch?"

Flies have a very fast reflex and can quickly evade any attempts to catch them. They are also able to fly in unpredictable patterns, making it even harder to catch them. This is why swatting at flies often proves to be ineffective.

Some people are also curious about the lifespan of flies.

Flies have a relatively short lifespan, typically ranging from a few days to a few weeks.

The exact lifespan depends on the species of fly and environmental factors. However, flies reproduce quickly, which is why they can maintain their population despite their short lifespan.

Many people wonder why flies are considered pests.

Flies are considered pests because they can spread diseases. They are known to carry bacteria and viruses on their bodies, which can be transmitted to humans when they land on food or surfaces.

What are the Benefits of Flies?

Despite being a source of problems for humans and often causing discomfort, flies play a crucial role in the pollination process of various horticultural plants and can enhance seed production yields.

What Do Flies Eat?

As adults, flies search for nectar from plants to meet their nutritional needs. Tachinid flies obtain nectar when they are in the adult phase, while their larvae prey on other insects. Other flies consume grass as their main food, while bot flies feed on animal tissue as a food source.

What Does a Fly Do When It Lands?

Once landed, pathogens such as bacteria, viruses, and parasites can easily spread to humans through the legs and fine hairs of flies.

After landing, flies engage in grooming activities by rubbing their legs. The purpose of this grooming is to clean the receptors on the hairs and fine hairs on the fly's legs.

item.title: Morning Motivational Quotes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
69 Morning Motivational Quotes for Success: Kick Off Your Start Day

Every sunrise brings a chance to begin anew. It welcomes the challenges that lie ahead—also seeking success in the flow of life's struggles. The early morning hours hold a unique magic—this moment fuels our dreams and sets the tone for the day. During these precious moments, we can produce a mindset of strength, resolution, and belief in our trip.

69 Morning Motivational Quotes for Success: Kick Off Your Start Day

Suppose you are facing a block in life or seeking inspiration to navigate the difficulties of daily life. These morning motivational quotes can serve as inspiration. They remind us of our innate strength and stability. Some of the world's greatest minds often crafted these morning motivational quotes. They capture insight from experience that exceeds time and case. These morning motivational quotes act as mantras of empowerment. They remind us that success comes from talent and every struggle is a stepping stone toward growth.

Join us on a journey through a collection of morning motivational quotes.

These capture the essence of success over hardship. As we explore these morning motivational quotes, they may be powerful enough to energize your mornings. May these uplift your spirits and move you towards fulfilling your dreams.

Here are some morning motivational quotes compiled from numerous sources, Friday (18/08/2023).

Morning Motivational Quotes

1. “Don’t be afraid to fail; it’s proof you’ll soon be successful.” —Barbara

2. “Always believe something wonderful is about to happen.”

3. “A year from now, you may wish you had started today.” —Karen Lamb.

4. “Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.” – Ralph Waldo Emerson

5. “Every morning, I wake up saying, 'I’m still alive, a miracle.' And so I keep on pushing.” — Jim Carrey

6. “When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive, to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.” – Marcus Aurelius

7. “Today’s goals: Coffee and kindness. Maybe two coffees, and then kindness.” – Nanea Hoffman

8. “I like freedom. I wake up in the morning and say, ‘I don’t know, should I have a popsicle or a donut?’ You know, who knows?” – Oscar Nunez
Photo: pixabay_Yeskay1211

Morning Motivational Quotes

9. “I used to love night best but the older I get the more treasures and hope and joy I find in mornings.” – Terri Guillemets

10. “An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.” – Henry David Thoreau

11. “If you’re changing the world, you’re working on important things. You’re excited to get up in the morning.” – Larry Page

12. “Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you’ll start to see a big difference in your life.” – Yoko Ono

13. “Lose an hour in the morning, and you will spend all day looking for it.” – Richard Whately

14. “I wake up laughing. Yes, I wake up in the morning and there I am just laughing my head off.” – Bruce Willis

Morning Motivational Quotes

neom-unsplash

Morning Motivational Quotes

15. “Some people dream of success, while other people get up every morning and make it happen.” – Wayne Huizenga

16. “First thing every morning before you arise say out loud, ‘I believe,’ three times.” – Ovid

17. “When I wake up in the morning, I feel like a billionaire without paying taxes.” – Ernie Banks

18. “Morning comes whether you set the alarm or not.” – Ursula K. Le Guin

19. “If you get up in the morning and think the future is going to be better, it is a bright day. Otherwise, it’s not.” – Elon Musk

20. “In these times you have to be an optimist to open your eyes when you awake in the morning.” – Carl Sandburg

21. “You know that feeling when you wake up in the morning and you’re excited for the day? That’s one of my main goals in life.” – Kirsten Dunst

22. “I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world.” – E. B. White

23. “I wake up in the morning and my heart is light, man. It’s not heavy. I don’t have skeletons in the closet on their way out.” – Drake

24. “Be the morning in everyone’s eyes and make their day turn into a thing of beauty.” ― Anthony T. Hincks

Photo: dave-unsplash

Morning Motivational Quotes

25. “The sun is a daily reminder that we too can rise again from the darkness, that we too can shine our own light.” – S. Ajna

26. “One key to success is to have lunch at the time of day most people have breakfast.” – Robert Brault

27. “In the morning a man walks with his whole body; in the evening, only with his legs.” – Ralph Waldo Emerson

28. “I get up every morning and it’s going to be a great day. You never know when it’s going to be over, so I refuse to have a bad day.” – Paul Henderson

29. “Your current life is the result of your previous choices, if you want something different, begin to choose differently.” – Joe Tichio

30. “The most important thing I do each morning is steady myself by not allowing a sense of urgency to penetrate.” – Matthew Weatherley-White

31. “Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.” — Robert Louis Stevenson

32. “First thing every morning before you arise say out loud, ‘I believe,’ three times.” – Ovid

33. “The repetition becomes the important thing; it’s a form of mesmerism. I mesmerize myself to reach a deeper state of mind.” – Haruki Murakami

Morning Motivational Quotes

34. “Every morning you have two choices: continue to sleep with your dreams, or wake up and chase them.”

35. “The silence in the morning holds lots of expectations and is more hopeful than the silence at night.” – Victoria Durnak

36. “I want you around in the morning and I want to know you’re legally required to be there.”

37. "Lots of people work hard, but successful people work hard at the right things.”

38. “I woke up this morning, I am blessed. You woke up this morning, you are blessed.”

39. “Love is nothing without action. Trust is nothing without proof. Sorry is nothing without change.”

40. “Every Morning Start a new page in your story make it a great one today.”
Photo: julian-hochgesang-unsplash

41. “Every day may not be good, but there is something good in every day.”

42. “Every day I wake up and choose to be happy because you give me a reason to.”

43. “The biggest sources of motivation are your own thoughts, so think big and motivate yourself to win.”

44. “I woke up in the morning; lay in my bed waiting until my mom will prepare breakfast. And suddenly I remember that I’m the mom.”

45. “Loneliness is a special enjoyment when chosen by ourselves, but hard to digest when gifted by others.”

46. “A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.”

47. “If I offer her to sleep over, she might misunderstand. And she will be right.”

48. “The individual who says it is not possible should move out of the way of those doing it.” —Tricia Cunningham

Photo: pexels-josh-hild

49. “Go as far as you can see and you will see further.” —Zig Ziglar

50. “Build your own dreams or someone else will hire you to build theirs.” —Farrah Gray

51. “Light tomorrow with today.” —Elizabeth Barrett Browning

52. “The breeze at dawn has secrets to tell you. Don't go back to sleep.” – Rumi

53. “Morning without you is a dwindled dawn.” – Emily Dickinson

54. “I like my coffee black and my mornings bright.” – Terri Guillemets

55. “It is a serious thing – just to be alive – on this fresh morning – in this broken world.” – Mary Oliver

56. “With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.” – Eleanor Roosevelt

57. “Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.” – Grandma Moses
Photo: martin-edholm-unsplash

58. “Rise up, start fresh see the bright opportunity in each day.”

59. “Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending.” – Maria Robinson

60. “The sun is a daily reminder that we too can rise again from the darkness, that we too can shine our own light.” – S. Ajna

61. “It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.” – Confucius

62. “If you’re changing the world, you’re working on important things. You’re excited to get up in the morning.” – Larry Page

63. “I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world.” – E. B. White

64. “Morning is an important time of day because how you spend your morning can often tell you what kind of day you are going to have.” ― Good Morning!

65. “In the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.” — Abraham Lincoln

66. “Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.”

67. “Happiness is always a choice You Can’t wait for circumstances to get better. You have to create your own good fortune. So look for ways to be happy every day.”

68. “There are so many reasons to be thankful every day. I am thankful for you.”

69. “Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending.” – Maria Robinson

Morning Motivational Quotes

As the sunrise rises in the sky, they release its warm glow upon the world. We can carry the wisdom of morning motivational quotes with us. These quotes are more than words; they ignite the fires of resolution, strength, and purpose within us.

Each day presents a fresh canvas upon which we can paint our dreams. As we bid farewell to this exploration of morning motivational quotes, let their resonance stay in your heart.

Photo: pexels-mo-eid

Morning Motivational Quotes for Success

Let these quotes guide you to rise above challenges and take chances of success. With these morning motivational quotes as your companions, may you take each day with renewed energy. So you can be confident of winning over hardship. Every sunrise marks the beginning of a new day. It is also a chance to light up your path to greatness.

item.title: quotes
item.dc:creator: Galang
item.content:encoded:
40 Funny Anniversary Quotes to Spice Up Your Special Day

40 Funny Anniversary Quotes to Spice Up Your Special Day

Would you be willing to add some laughter to your special day? Funny anniversary quotes are the perfect way to celebrate love and humor together! Whether you're celebrating one year or fifty, these witty sayings will light up the mood and bring a smile to your face.

However, you don't need to have a wedding anniversary to use one of these funny anniversary quotes to celebrate another year of love. These wishes for couples are appropriate for recognizing any meaningful event. So, grab a seat! Let's dive into the world of funny anniversary quotes that will make your milestone even more memorable!

1. "Our marriage is like a deck of cards. It includes two hearts and a diamond but also two jokers at the end of the day."

2. "A happy marriage is basically like an endless sleepover with a best friend."

3. "If love is blind then marriage is a real eye-opener. Thank God we're a perfect match and our married life is super hot."

4. "You're my lifetime subscription to love."

5. "Let's pinky swear we'll celebrate every wedding anniversary like it's our first."

6. "Forgot to cancel my 30-day marriage trial... Phew!"

7. "Happy anniversary! I want to spend the rest of my money with you."

8. "Another year together and I'd still choose you over a room full of puppies."

9. "Sorry, no refunds. Happy anniversary!"

10. "Choosing you makes up for all the bad decisions I've ever made."

11. "Saying 'I Do' to you for the rest of my life is the smartest thing I ever did."

12. "Even though we have more grey hair, wrinkles and body aches, celebrating our marriage anniversary never gets old."

13. "Thanks for never streaming a [favorite series name] without me by your side."

14. "We're the perfect pair. You're the jelly to my peanut butter, the tonic to my gin, the mold to my cheese... I do really love stinky blue cheese."

15. "My love for you still gives me the same feeling as when I see my food coming at a restaurant."

16. "Let's jump into the richly imagined future together for another whole year of questionable adventures."

17. "This box of chocolates reminds me of you — sweet, salty, nutty and very addictive."

18. "Beyond grateful (and relieved) that we both swiped right."

19. "Love is great but a little 'rizz' never hurts either (and you've got lots of it)."

20. "You'll always be the only person I send heart eye emojis to."

21. "There's no one else in the world I'd rather have snoring next me."
